person of any kind for whose acts you need be responsible. I am a
judicially competent person, a man of twenty-five years of age, a
university graduate, a gentleman, and, until I met yourself, a complete
stranger to you. Only my boundless respect for your merits restrains me
from demanding satisfaction at your hands, as well as a further
explanation as to the reasons which have led you to take it upon
yourself to answer for my conduct.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General'], ['The Baron'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The Baron'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General']]]

quoteText:
Nor do I intend to let the Baron off, And since you,
General, have today been so good as to listen to the Baron s
complaints, and to enter into his concerns since you have made yourself
a participator in the affair I have the honour to inform you that,
tomorrow morning at the latest, I shall, in my own name, demand of the
said Baron a formal explanation as to the reasons which have led him to
disregard the fact that the matter lies between him and myself alone,
and to put a slight upon me by referring it to another person, as
though I were unworthy to answer for my own conduct.
subQuotationList:
['Nor do I intend to let the Baron off,', 'And since you,
General, have today been so good as to listen to the Baron s
complaints, and to enter into his concerns since you have made yourself
a participator in the affair I have the honour to inform you that,
tomorrow morning at the latest, I shall, in my own name, demand of the
said Baron a formal explanation as to the reasons which have led him to
disregard the fact that the matter lies between him and myself alone,
and to put a slight upon me by referring it to another person, as
though I were unworthy to answer for my own conduct.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Baron']], [['The General'], ['The General'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron']]]

quoteText:
What? Do you intend to go on with this damned nonsense? Do
you not realise the harm that it is doing me? I beg of you not to laugh
at me, sir not to laugh at me, for we have police authorities here who,
out of respect for my rank, and for that of the Baron... In short, sir,
I swear to you that I will have you arrested, and marched out of the
place, to prevent any further brawling on your part. Do you understand
what I say?
subQuotationList:
['What?', 'Do you intend to go on with this damned nonsense? Do
you not realise the harm that it is doing me? I beg of you not to laugh
at me, sir not to laugh at me, for we have police authorities here who,
out of respect for my rank, and for that of the Baron... In short, sir,
I swear to you that I will have you arrested, and marched out of the
place, to prevent any further brawling on your part. Do you understand
what I say?']
speaker: The General
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['The Baron'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
General, one cannot arrest a man for brawling until he has brawled. I have not
so much as begun my explanations to the Baron, and you are altogether
ignorant as to the form and time which my intended procedure is likely
to assume. I wish but to disabuse the Baron of what is, to me, a
shameful supposition namely, that I am under the guardianship of a
person who is qualified to exercise control over my free will. It is
vain for you to disturb and alarm yourself.
subQuotationList:
['General,', 'one cannot arrest a man for brawling until he has brawled. I have not
so much as begun my explanations to the Baron, and you are altogether

shameful supposition namely, that I am under the guardianship of a
person who is qualified to exercise control over my free will. It is
vain for you to disturb and alarm yourself.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
For God s sake, Alexis Ivanovitch, do put an end to this senseless
scheme of yours! Do you
know what is likely to come of it? Merely further unpleasantness. You
will agree with me, I am sure, that at present I ought to move with
especial care yes, with very especial care. You cannot be fully aware
of how I am situated. When we leave this place I shall be ready to
receive you back into my household; but, for the time being I  Well, I
cannot tell you all my reasons.

quoteText: O Alexis Ivanovitch, Alexis Ivanovitch!
subQuotationList: ['O Alexis Ivanovitch, Alexis Ivanovitch!']
speaker: The General

quoteText: move with especial care at present
subQuotationList: ['move with especial care at present']
speaker: The General
referringExpression: the General had avowed to me

quoteText:
I have come to see you on business, nor will I seek to conceal from you the
fact that I have come in the capacity of an emissary, of an
intermediary, from the General. Having small knowledge of the Russian
tongue, I lost most of what was said last night; but, the General has
now explained matters, and I must confess that
subQuotationList:
['I have come to see you on business,', 'nor will I seek to conceal from you the
fact that I have come in the capacity of an emissary, of an
intermediary, from the General. Having small knowledge of the Russian
tongue, I lost most of what was said last night; but, the General has
now explained matters, and I must confess that']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
See here, Monsieur de Griers, I understand that you
have undertaken to act in this affair as an intermediary. Of course I
am only  un utchitel,  a tutor, and have never claimed to be an
intimate of this household, nor to stand on at all familiar terms with
it. Consequently, I do not know the whole of its circumstances. Yet
pray explain to me this: have you yourself become one of its members,
seeing that you are beginning to take such a part in everything, and
are now present as an intermediary?
subQuotationList:
['See here, Monsieur de Griers,', 'I understand that you
have undertaken to act in this affair as an intermediary. Of course I
am only  un utchitel,  a tutor, and have never claimed to be an
intimate of this household, nor to stand on at all familiar terms with
it. Consequently, I do not know the whole of its circumstances. Yet
pray explain to me this: have you yourself become one of its members,
seeing that you are beginning to take such a part in everything, and
are now present as an intermediary?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
I am connected with the General, partly through
business affairs, and partly through special circumstances. My
principal has sent me merely to ask you to forego your intentions of
last evening. What you contemplate is, I have no doubt, very clever;
yet he has charged me to represent to you that you have not the
slightest chance of succeeding in your end, since not only will the
Baron refuse to receive you, but also he (the Baron) has at his
disposal every possible means for obviating further unpleasantness from
you. Surely you can see that yourself? What, then, would be the good of
going on with it all? On the other hand, the General promises that at
the first favourable opportunity he will receive you back into his
household, and, in the meantime, will credit you with your salary with
 vos appointements.  Surely that will suit you, will it not?
subQuotationList:
['I am connected with the General,', 'partly through
business affairs, and partly through special circumstances. My
principal has sent me merely to ask you to forego your intentions of
last evening. What you contemplate is, I have no doubt, very clever;

the first favourable opportunity he will receive you back into his
household, and, in the meantime, will credit you with your salary with
 vos appointements.  Surely that will suit you, will it not?']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General']], [['The General'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General']]]

quoteText:
Good heavens! Seeing that the General takes such an
interest in the matter, is there anything very unnatural in his
desiring also to know your plans?
subQuotationList: ['Good heavens!', 'Seeing that the General takes such an\ninterest in the matter, is there anything very unnatural in his\ndesiring also to know your plans?']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
In short, my one desire is that the Baron may make it
possible for me to adopt the latter course.
subQuotationList: ['In short,', 'my one desire is that the Baron may make it\npossible for me to adopt the latter course.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Oh fie! What refinements and subtleties! Besides, what have you to express regret for? Confess, Monsieur,
Monsieur pardon me, but I have forgotten your name confess, I say, that
all this is merely a plan to annoy the General? Or perhaps, you have
some other and special end in view? Eh?
subQuotationList:
['Oh fie! What refinements and subtleties!', 'Besides, what have you to express regret for? Confess, Monsieur,
Monsieur pardon me, but I have forgotten your name confess, I say, that
all this is merely a plan to annoy the General? Or perhaps, you have

speaker: Marqis De Griers
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
In return you must pardon _me_, mon cher Marquis, and tell me what
_you_ have to do with it.
subQuotationList: ['In return you must pardon _me_, mon cher Marquis, and tell me what\n_you_ have to do with it.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: The General
subQuotationList: ['The General']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
But what of the General? Last night he said that, for some reason or
another, it behoved him to  move with especial care at present; 
wherefore, he was feeling nervous. But I did not understand the
reference.
subQuotationList:
['But what of the General? Last night he said that, for some reason or
another, it behoved him to  move with especial care at present; 
wherefore, he was feeling nervous. But I did not understand the
reference.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Yes, there _do_ exist special reasons for his doing so, You are
acquainted with Mlle. de Cominges, are you not?
subQuotationList: ['Yes, there _do_ exist special reasons for his doing so,', 'You are\nacquainted with Mlle. de Cominges, are you not?']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText: Mlle. Blanche, you mean?
subQuotationList: ['Mlle. Blanche, you mean?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Yes, Mlle. Blanche de Cominges. Doubtless you know also that the
General is in love with this young lady, and may even be about to marry
her before he leaves here? Imagine, therefore, what any scene or
scandal would entail upon him!
subQuotationList:
['Yes, Mlle. Blanche de Cominges. Doubtless you know also that the
General is in love with this young lady, and may even be about to marry
her before he leaves here? Imagine, therefore, what any scene or
scandal would entail upon him!']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
I cannot see that the marriage scheme need, be affected by scenes or
scandals.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot see that the marriage scheme need, be affected by scenes or\nscandals.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Mais le Baron est si irascible un caract re prussien, vous savez!
Enfin il fera une querelle d Allemand.
subQuotationList: ['Mais le Baron est si irascible un caract re prussien, vous savez!\nEnfin il fera une querelle d Allemand.']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
I do not care, seeing that I no longer belong to his
household But is it quite settled that Mlle. is to marry the General?
What are they waiting for? Why should they conceal such a matter at all
events from ourselves, the General s own party?
subQuotationList:
['I do not care,', 'seeing that I no longer belong to his
household', 'But is it quite settled that Mlle. is to marry the General?
What are they waiting for? Why should they conceal such a matter at all

speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The General']], [['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General']]]

quoteText:
I cannot tell you. The marriage is not yet a settled affair, for they
are awaiting news from Russia. The General has business transactions to
arrange.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot tell you. The marriage is not yet a settled affair, for they\nare awaiting news from Russia. The General has business transactions to\narrange.']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText: Ah! Connected, doubtless, with madame his mother?
subQuotationList: ['Ah! Connected, doubtless, with madame his mother?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
To cut things short, I have complete confidence in
your native politeness, as well as in your tact and good sense. I feel
sure that you will do what I suggest, even if it is only for the sake
of this family which has received you as a kinsman into its bosom and
has always loved and respected you.
subQuotationList:
['To cut things short,', 'I have complete confidence in
your native politeness, as well as in your tact and good sense. I feel
sure that you will do what I suggest, even if it is only for the sake
of this family which has received you as a kinsman into its bosom and
has always loved and respected you.']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
Be so good as to observe, that the same family has just
_expelled_ me from its bosom. All that you are saying you are saying
but for show; but, when people have just said to you,  Of course we do
not wish to turn you out, yet, for the sake of appearance s, you must
_permit_ yourself to be turned out,  nothing can matter very much.
subQuotationList:
['Be so good as to observe,', 'that the same family has just
_expelled_ me from its bosom. All that you are saying you are saying
but for show; but, when people have just said to you,  Of course we do
not wish to turn you out, yet, for the sake of appearance s, you must

speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
Very well, then, Seeing that my solicitations have had no effect upon you, it is my
duty to mention that other measures will be taken. There exist here
police, you must remember, and this very day they shall send you
packing. Que diable! To think of a blanc bec like yourself challenging
a person like the Baron to a duel! Do you suppose that you will be
_allowed_ to do such things? Just try doing them, and see if any one
will be afraid of you! The reason why I have asked you to desist is
that I can see that your conduct is causing the General annoyance. Do
you believe that the Baron could not tell his lacquey simply to put you
out of doors?
subQuotationList:
['Very well, then,', 'Seeing that my solicitations have had no effect upon you, it is my
duty to mention that other measures will be taken. There exist here
police, you must remember, and this very day they shall send you
packing. Que diable! To think of a blanc bec like yourself challenging
a person like the Baron to a duel! Do you suppose that you will be
_allowed_ to do such things? Just try doing them, and see if any one
will be afraid of you! The reason why I have asked you to desist is
that I can see that your conduct is causing the General annoyance. Do
you believe that the Baron could not tell his lacquey simply to put you
out of doors?']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The Baron'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Nevertheless I should not GO out of doors, You are labouring under a delusion, Monsieur de Griers. The
thing will be done in far better trim than you imagine. I was just
about to start for Mr. Astley s, to ask him to be my intermediary in
other words, my second. He has a strong liking for me, and I do not
think that he will refuse. He will go and see the Baron on MY behalf,
and the Baron will certainly not decline to receive him. Although I am
only a tutor a kind of subaltern, Mr. Astley is known to all men as the
nephew of a real English lord, the Lord Piebroch, as well as a lord in
his own right. Yes, you may be pretty sure that the Baron will be civil
to Mr. Astley, and listen to him. Or, should he decline to do so, Mr.
Astley will take the refusal as a personal affront to himself (for you
know how persistent the English are?) and thereupon introduce to the
Baron a friend of his own (and he has many friends in a good position).
That being so, picture to yourself the issue of the affair an affair
which will not quite end as you think it will.

That being so, picture to yourself the issue of the affair an affair

speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Once more I beg of you to let the matter drop, One would think that it actually
_pleased_ you to have scenes! Indeed, it is a brawl rather than genuine
satisfaction that you are seeking. I have said that the affair may
prove to be diverting, and even clever, and that possibly you may
attain something by it; yet none the less I tell you that I have come
hither also to hand you these few words from a certain person. Read
them, please, for I must take her back an answer.
subQuotationList:
['Once more I beg of you to let the matter drop,', 'One would think that it actually

satisfaction that you are seeking. I have said that the affair may
prove to be diverting, and even clever, and that possibly you may
attain something by it; yet none the less I tell you', 'that I have come
hither also to hand you these few words from a certain person. Read

speaker: Marqis De Griers
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText: Very well,
subQuotationList: ['Very well,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
you can tell Mlle. not to disturb herself. But, I would also ask you why you have been so long in
handing me this note? Instead of chattering about trifles, you ought to
have delivered me the missive at once if you have really come
commissioned as you say.
subQuotationList:
['you can tell Mlle. not to disturb herself. But,', 'I would also ask you why you have been so long in
handing me this note? Instead of chattering about trifles, you ought to
have delivered me the missive at once if you have really come
commissioned as you say.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
Well, pardon some natural haste on my part, for the situation is so
strange. I wished first to gain some personal knowledge of your
intentions; and, moreover, I did not know the contents of the note, and
thought that it could be given you at any time.
subQuotationList:
['Well, pardon some natural haste on my part, for the situation is so
strange. I wished first to gain some personal knowledge of your
intentions; and, moreover, I did not know the contents of the note, and
thought that it could be given you at any time.']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
I understand, So you were ordered to hand me the note
only in the last resort, and if you could not otherwise appease me? Is
it not so? Speak out, Monsieur de Griers.
subQuotationList: ['I understand,', 'So you were ordered to hand me the note\nonly in the last resort, and if you could not otherwise appease me? Is\nit not so? Speak out, Monsieur de Griers.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Perhaps,
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps,']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
You and I are to have a reckoning later, Master Frenchman, Yes, we will measure our strength
together.
subQuotationList: ['You and I are to have a reckoning later, Master Frenchman,', 'Yes, we will measure our strength\ntogether.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
I was just coming to see you, and you appear to be out on a
similar errand. So you have parted with your employers?
subQuotationList: ['I was just coming to see you,', 'and you appear to be out on a\nsimilar errand. So you have parted with your employers?']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
How do you know that? Is _every one_ aware
of the fact?
subQuotationList: ['How do you know that?', 'Is _every one_ aware\nof the fact?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
By no means. Not every one would consider such a fact to be of moment.
Indeed, I have never heard any one speak of it.
subQuotationList: ['By no means. Not every one would consider such a fact to be of moment.\nIndeed, I have never heard any one speak of it.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Then how come you to know it?
subQuotationList: ['Then how come you to know it?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Because I have had occasion to do so. Whither are you bound? I like
you, and was therefore coming to pay you a visit.
subQuotationList: ['Because I have had occasion to do so. Whither are you bound? I like\nyou, and was therefore coming to pay you a visit.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
What a splendid fellow you are, Mr. Astley! And since I have not yet
had my coffee, and you have, in all probability, scarcely tasted yours,
let us adjourn to the Casino Caf , where we can sit and smoke and have
a talk.
subQuotationList:
['What a splendid fellow you are, Mr. Astley!', 'And since I have not yet
had my coffee, and you have, in all probability, scarcely tasted yours,
let us adjourn to the Casino Caf , where we can sit and smoke and have
a talk.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley']], [['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
I do not intend to go away, I intend, on the
contrary, to remain here.
subQuotationList: ['I do not intend to go away,', 'I intend, on the\ncontrary, to remain here.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: That I never doubted,
subQuotationList: ['That I never doubted,']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: No, I fear not,
subQuotationList: ['No, I fear not,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
And concerning this Marquis and Mlle. Polina you know nothing beyond
surmise?
subQuotationList: ['And concerning this Marquis and Mlle. Polina you know nothing beyond\nsurmise?']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: No, I know nothing _for certain_ about them No nothing.
subQuotationList: ['No, I know nothing _for certain_ about them', 'No nothing.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Then you have done very wrong to speak of them to me, or even to
imagine things about them.
subQuotationList: ['Then you have done very wrong to speak of them to me, or even to\nimagine things about them.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
Quite so, quite so, I admit
that. Yet that is not the question.
subQuotationList: ['Quite so, quite so,', 'I admit\nthat. Yet that is not the question.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
What do you make of it? When I met you I was just coming to
ask you your opinion. For myself, I could have killed this Frenchman,
and am not sure that I shall not do so even yet.
subQuotationList: ['What do you make of it?', 'When I met you I was just coming to\nask you your opinion. For myself, I could have killed this Frenchman,\nand am not sure that I shall not do so even yet.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Astley']], [['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
I feel the same about it, As for Mlle. Polina well,
you yourself know that, if necessity drives, one enters into relation
with people whom one simply detests. Even between this couple there may
be something which, though unknown to you, depends upon extraneous
circumstances. For, my own part, I think that you may reassure
yourself or at all events partially. And as for Mlle. Polina s
proceedings of two days ago, they were, of course, strange; not because
she can have meant to get rid of you, or to earn for you a thrashing
from the Baron s cudgel (which for some curious reason, he did not use,
although he had it ready in his hands), but because such proceedings on
the part of such well, of such a refined lady as Mlle. Polina are, to
say the least of it, unbecoming. But she cannot have guessed that you
would carry out her absurd wish to the letter?

you yourself know that, if necessity drives, one enters into relation

speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron'], ['The Baron'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
Do you know what? I believe that you have already heard the story from some
one very possibly from Mlle. Polina herself?
subQuotationList: ['Do you know what?', 'I believe that you have already heard the story from some\none very possibly from Mlle. Polina herself?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Your eyes look very fiery, and in them I can read suspicion. Now, you have no right whatever to
be suspicious. It is not a right which I can for a moment recognise,
and I absolutely refuse to answer your questions.
subQuotationList: ['Your eyes look very fiery,', 'and in them I can read suspicion. Now, you have no right whatever to\nbe suspicious. It is not a right which I can for a moment recognise,\nand I absolutely refuse to answer your questions.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Enough! You need say no more,
subQuotationList: ['Enough! You need say no more,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Very well, very well, Then I stand confounded, and have no further opinions to offer. But
you are a good fellow, and I am glad to know what you think about it
all, even though I do not need your advice.
subQuotationList: ['Very well, very well,', 'Then I stand confounded, and have no further opinions to offer. But\nyou are a good fellow, and I am glad to know what you think about it\nall, even though I do not need your advice.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
For instance, what reason should you assign for the General taking
fright in this way? Why should my stupid clowning have led the world to
elevate it into a serious incident? Even De Griers has found it
necessary to put in his oar (and he only interferes on the most
important occasions), and to visit me, and to address to me the most
earnest supplications. Yes, _he_, De Griers, has actually been playing
the suppliant to _me!_ And, mark you, although he came to me as early
as nine o clock, he had ready-prepared in his hand Mlle. Polina s note.
When, I would ask, was that note written? Mlle. Polina must have been
aroused from sleep for the express purpose of writing it. At all events
the circumstance shows that she is an absolute slave to the Frenchman,
since she actually begs my pardon in the note actually begs my pardon!
Yet what is her personal concern in the matter? Why is she interested
in it at all? Why, too, is the whole party so afraid of this precious
Baron? And what sort of a business do you call it for the General to be
going to marry Mlle. Blanche de Cominges? He told me last night that,
because of the circumstance, he must  move with especial care at
present.  What is your opinion of it all? Your look convinces me that
you know more about it than I do.

quoteText:
Yes, I think I _do_ know more about it than you do, The
affair centres around this Mlle. Blanche. Of that I feel certain.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I think I _do_ know more about it than you do,', 'The\naffair centres around this Mlle. Blanche. Of that I feel certain.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: And what of Mlle. Blanche?
subQuotationList: ['And what of Mlle. Blanche?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Well, my belief is that at the present moment Mlle. Blanche has, in
very truth, a special reason for wishing to avoid any trouble with the
Baron and the Baroness. It might lead not only to some unpleasantness,
but even to a scandal.
subQuotationList:
['Well, my belief is that at the present moment Mlle. Blanche has, in
very truth, a special reason for wishing to avoid any trouble with the
Baron and the Baroness. It might lead not only to some unpleasantness,
but even to a scandal.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Oh, oh!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, oh!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Also I may tell you that Mlle. Blanche has been in Roulettenberg
before, for she was staying here three seasons ago. I myself was in the
place at the time, and in those days Mlle. Blanche was not known as
Mlle. de Cominges, nor was her mother, the Widow de Cominges, even in
existence. In any case no one ever mentioned the latter. De Griers,
too, had not materialised, and I am convinced that not only do the
parties stand in no relation to one another, but also they have not
long enjoyed one another s acquaintance. Likewise, the _Marquisate_ de
Griers is of recent creation. Of that I have reason to be sure, owing
to a certain circumstance. Even the name De Griers itself may be taken
to be a new invention, seeing that I have a friend who once met the
said  Marquis  under a different name altogether.
subQuotationList:

said  Marquis  under a different name altogether.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionTextsList: [['you', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'she', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Mlle. de Cominges', 'De Griers', 'they', 'the _Marquisate_ de\nGriers', 'De Griers', 'the\nsaid  Marquis']]
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Yet he possesses a good circle of friends?
subQuotationList: ['Yet he possesses a good circle of friends?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Possibly. Mlle. Blanche also may possess that. Yet it is not three
years since she received from the local police, at the instance of the
Baroness, an invitation to leave the town. And she left it.
subQuotationList: ['Possibly. Mlle. Blanche also may possess that. Yet it is not three\nyears since she received from the local police, at the instance of the\nBaroness, an invitation to leave the town. And she left it.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: But why?
subQuotationList: ['But why?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Well, I must tell you that she first appeared here in company with an
Italian a prince of some sort, a man who bore an historic name
(Barberini or something of the kind). The fellow was simply a mass of
rings and diamonds real diamonds, too and the couple used to drive out
in a marvellous carriage. At first Mlle. Blanche played  trente et
quarante  with fair success, but, later, her luck took a marked change
for the worse. I distinctly remember that in a single evening she lost
an enormous sum. But worse was to ensue, for one fine morning her
prince disappeared horses, carriage, and all. Also, the hotel bill
which he left unpaid was enormous. Upon this Mlle. Zelma (the name
which she assumed after figuring as Madame Barberini) was in despair.
She shrieked and howled all over the hotel, and even tore her clothes
in her frenzy. In the hotel there was staying also a Polish count (you
must know that ALL travelling Poles are counts!), and the spectacle of
Mlle. Zelma tearing her clothes and, catlike, scratching her face with
her beautiful, scented nails produced upon him a strong impression. So
the pair had a talk together, and, by luncheon time, she was consoled.
Indeed, that evening the couple entered the Casino arm-in-arm Mlle.
Zelma laughing loudly, according to her custom, and showing even more
expansiveness in her manners than she had before shown. For instance,
she thrust her way into the file of women roulette-players in the exact
fashion of those ladies who, to clear a space for themselves at the
tables, push their fellow-players roughly aside. Doubtless you have
noticed them?

quoteText: Yes, certainly.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, certainly.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Well, they are not worth noticing. To the annoyance of the decent
public they are allowed to remain here at all events such of them as
daily change 4000 franc notes at the tables (though, as soon as ever
these women cease to do so, they receive an invitation to depart).
However, Mlle. Zelma continued to change notes of this kind, but her
play grew more and more unsuccessful, despite the fact that such
ladies  luck is frequently good, for they have a surprising amount of
cash at their disposal. Suddenly, the Count too disappeared, even as
the Prince had done, and that same evening Mlle. Zelma was forced to
appear in the Casino alone. On this occasion no one offered her a
greeting. Two days later she had come to the end of her resources;
whereupon, after staking and losing her last louis d or she chanced to
look around her, and saw standing by her side the Baron Burmergelm, who
had been eyeing her with fixed disapproval. To his distaste, however,
Mlle. paid no attention, but, turning to him with her well-known smile,
requested him to stake, on her behalf, ten louis on the red. Later that
evening a complaint from the Baroness led the authorities to request
Mlle. not to re-enter the Casino. If you feel in any way surprised that
I should know these petty and unedifying details, the reason is that I
had them from a relative of mine who, later that evening, drove Mlle.
Zelma in his carriage from Roulettenberg to Spa. Now, mark you, Mlle.
wants to become Madame General, in order that, in future, she may be
spared the receipt of such invitations from Casino authorities as she
received three years ago. At present she is not playing; but that is
only because, according to the signs, she is lending money to other
players. Yes, that is a much more paying game. I even suspect that the
unfortunate General is himself in her debt, as well as, perhaps, also
De Griers. Or, it may be that the latter has entered into a partnership
with her. Consequently you yourself will see that, until the marriage
shall have been consummated, Mlle. would scarcely like to have the
attention of the Baron and the Baroness drawn to herself. In short, to
any one in her position, a scandal would be most detrimental. You form
a member of the m nage of these people; wherefore, any act of yours
might cause such a scandal and the more so since daily she appears in
public arm in arm with the General or with Mlle. Polina. _Now_ do you
understand?

quoteText:
No, I do not! Tell me, Mr. Astley, why, if you knew this history
all along, and, consequently, always knew who this Mlle. Blanche is,
you never warned either myself or the General, nor, most of all, Mlle.
Polina How could you do it?
subQuotationList:
['No, I do not!', 'Tell me, Mr. Astley, why, if you knew this history
all along, and, consequently, always knew who this Mlle. Blanche is,
you never warned either myself or the General, nor, most of all, Mlle.
Polina', 'How could you do it?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['The General'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']], [['Mr. Astley']]]

quoteText:
It would have done no good to warn you, for the
reason that you could have effected nothing. Against what was I to warn
you? As likely as not, the General knows more about Mlle. Blanche even
than I do; yet the unhappy man still walks about with her and Mlle.
Polina. Only yesterday I saw this Frenchwoman riding, splendidly
mounted, with De Griers, while the General was careering in their wake
on a roan horse. He had said, that morning, that his legs were hurting
him, yet his riding-seat was easy enough. As he passed I looked at him,
and the thought occurred to me that he was a man lost for ever.
However, it is no affair of mine, for I have only recently had the
happiness to make Mlle. Polina s acquaintance. Also I have already told you that I do not recognise your
right to ask me certain questions, however sincere be my liking for
you.
subQuotationList:

happiness to make Mlle. Polina s acquaintance. Also', 'I have already told you that I do not recognise your
right to ask me certain questions, however sincere be my liking for
you.']

quoteText:
Enough, To me it is as clear as day that Mlle.
Polina knows all about this Mlle. Blanche, but cannot bring herself to
part with her Frenchman; wherefore, she consents also to be seen in
public with Mlle. Blanche. You may be sure that nothing else would ever
have induced her either to walk about with this Frenchwoman or to send
me a note not to touch the Baron. Yes, it is _there_ that the influence
lies before which everything in the world must bow! Yet she herself it
was who launched me at the Baron! The devil take it, but I was left no
choice in the matter.

['Enough,', 'To me it is as clear as day that Mlle.

part with her Frenchman; wherefore, she consents also to be seen in

have induced her either to walk about with this Frenchwoman or to send

lies before which everything in the world must bow! Yet she herself it
was who launched me at the Baron! The devil take it, but I was left no
choice in the matter.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You forget, in the first place, that this Mlle. de Cominges is the
General s inamorata, and, in the second place, that Mlle. Polina, the
General s step-daughter, has a younger brother and sister who, though
they are the General s own children, are completely neglected by this
madman, and robbed as well.
subQuotationList:
['You forget, in the first place, that this Mlle. de Cominges is the
General s inamorata, and, in the second place, that Mlle. Polina, the
General s step-daughter, has a younger brother and sister who, though
they are the General s own children, are completely neglected by this
madman, and robbed as well.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['The General'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General']]]

quoteText:
Yes, yes; that is so. For me to go and desert the children now would
mean their total abandonment; whereas, if I remain, I should be able to
defend their interests, and, perhaps, to save a moiety of their
property. Yes, yes; that is quite true. And yet, and yet Oh, I can well
understand why they are all so interested in the General s mother!
subQuotationList:
['Yes, yes; that is so. For me to go and desert the children now would
mean their total abandonment; whereas, if I remain, I should be able to
defend their interests, and, perhaps, to save a moiety of their
property. Yes, yes; that is quite true. And yet, and yet Oh, I can well
understand why they are all so interested in the General s mother!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: In whom?
subQuotationList: ['In whom?']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
In the old woman of Moscow who declines to die, yet concerning whom
they are for ever expecting telegrams to notify the fact of her death.
subQuotationList: ['In the old woman of Moscow who declines to die, yet concerning whom\nthey are for ever expecting telegrams to notify the fact of her death.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Ah, then of course their interests centre around her. It is a question
of succession. Let that but be settled, and the General will marry,
Mlle. Polina will be set free, and De Griers
subQuotationList: ['Ah, then of course their interests centre around her. It is a question\nof succession. Let that but be settled, and the General will marry,\nMlle. Polina will be set free, and De Griers']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna', 'The General'], ['The General'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Yes, and De Griers?
subQuotationList: ['Yes, and De Griers?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Will be repaid his money, which is what he is now waiting for.
subQuotationList: ['Will be repaid his money, which is what he is now waiting for.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: What? You think that he is waiting for _that?_
subQuotationList: ['What? You think that he is waiting for _that?_']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: I know of nothing else,
subQuotationList: ['I know of nothing else,']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
But, I do, I do! He is waiting also for the
old woman s will, for the reason that it awards Mlle. Polina a dowry.
As soon as ever the money is received, she will throw herself upon the
Frenchman s neck. All women are like that. Even the proudest of them
become abject slaves where marriage is concerned. What Polina is good
for is to fall head over ears in love. That is _my_ opinion. Look at
her especially when she is sitting alone, and plunged in thought. All
this was pre-ordained and foretold, and is accursed. Polina could
perpetrate any mad act. She she But who called me by name? Who is shouting for me? I heard some one calling in Russian, It was a woman s voice. Listen!
subQuotationList:
['But, I do, I do!', 'He is waiting also for the
old woman s will, for the reason that it awards Mlle. Polina a dowry.

this was pre-ordained and foretold, and is accursed. Polina could
perpetrate any mad act. She she But who called me by name?', 'Who is shouting for me? I heard some one calling in Russian,', 'It was a woman s voice. Listen!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']], [], []]

quoteText:
Yes, I _did_ hear a woman s voice calling, but whose I do not know.
The someone was calling you in Russian. Ah! NOW I can see whence the
cries come. They come from that lady there the one who is sitting on
the settee, the one who has just been escorted to the verandah by a
crowd of lacqueys. Behind her see that pile of luggage! She must have
arrived by train.
subQuotationList:
['Yes, I _did_ hear a woman s voice calling, but whose I do not know.
The someone was calling you in Russian. Ah! NOW I can see whence the
cries come. They come from that lady there the one who is sitting on
the settee, the one who has just been escorted to the verandah by a
crowd of lacqueys. Behind her see that pile of luggage! She must have
arrived by train.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
But why should she be calling _me?_ Hear her calling again! See! She
is beckoning to us!
subQuotationList: ['But why should she be calling _me?_ Hear her calling again! See! She\nis beckoning to us!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: Yes, so she is,
subQuotationList: ['Yes, so she is,']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Alexis Ivanovitch, Alexis Ivanovitch! Good heavens, what a stupid
fellow!
subQuotationList: ['Alexis Ivanovitch, Alexis Ivanovitch! Good heavens, what a stupid\nfellow!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
And this is the woman whom they had thought to see in her grave after
making her will! Yet she will outlive us, and
every one else in the hotel. Good Lord! what is going to become of us
now? What on earth is to happen to the General? She will turn the place
upside down!
subQuotationList:
['And this is the woman whom they had thought to see in her grave after
making her will!', 'Yet she will outlive us, and
every one else in the hotel. Good Lord! what is going to become of us
now? What on earth is to happen to the General? She will turn the place
upside down!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
My good sir, what are
you standing _there_ for, with your eyes almost falling out of your
head? Cannot you come and say how-do-you-do? Are you too proud to shake
hands? Or do you not recognise me? Here, Potapitch! Just think! Alexis Ivanovitch does not recognise me!
They have buried me for good and all! Yes, and after sending hosts of
telegrams to know if I were dead or not! Yes, yes, I have heard the
whole story. I am very much alive, though, as you may see.
subQuotationList:
['My good sir,', 'what are
you standing _there_ for, with your eyes almost falling out of your
head? Cannot you come and say how-do-you-do? Are you too proud to shake
hands? Or do you not recognise me? Here, Potapitch!', 'Just think! Alexis Ivanovitch does not recognise me!
They have buried me for good and all! Yes, and after sending hosts of
telegrams to know if I were dead or not! Yes, yes, I have heard the
whole story. I am very much alive, though, as you may see.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Potapitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Pardon me, Antonida Vassilievna, _I_ have no reason to wish you ill. I
am merely rather astonished to see you. Why should I not be so, seeing
how unexpected
subQuotationList: ['Pardon me, Antonida Vassilievna,', '_I_ have no reason to wish you ill. I\nam merely rather astonished to see you. Why should I not be so, seeing\nhow unexpected']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
_Why_ should you be astonished? I just got into my chair, and came.
Things are quiet enough in the train, for there is no one there to
chatter. Have you been out for a walk?
subQuotationList: ['_Why_ should you be astonished? I just got into my chair, and came.\nThings are quiet enough in the train, for there is no one there to\nchatter. Have you been out for a walk?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Yes. I have just been to the Casino.
subQuotationList: ['Yes. I have just been to the Casino.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Oh? Well, it is quite nice here, The place seems comfortable, and all the trees are out. I like it very
well. Are your people at home? Is the General, for instance, indoors?
subQuotationList: ['Oh? Well, it is quite nice here,', 'The place seems comfortable, and all the trees are out. I like it very\nwell. Are your people at home? Is the General, for instance, indoors?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General']]]

quoteText: Yes; and probably all of them.
subQuotationList: ['Yes; and probably all of them.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Do they observe the convenances, and keep up appearances? Such things
always give one tone. I have heard that they are keeping a carriage,
even as Russian gentlefolks ought to do. When abroad, our Russian
people always cut a dash. Is Prascovia here too?
subQuotationList:
['Do they observe the convenances, and keep up appearances? Such things
always give one tone. I have heard that they are keeping a carriage,
even as Russian gentlefolks ought to do. When abroad, our Russian
people always cut a dash. Is Prascovia here too?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText: Yes. Polina Alexandrovna is here.
subQuotationList: ['Yes. Polina Alexandrovna is here.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
And the Frenchwoman? However, I will go and look for them myself. Tell
me the nearest way to their rooms. Do _you_ like being here?
subQuotationList: ['And the Frenchwoman? However, I will go and look for them myself. Tell\nme the nearest way to their rooms. Do _you_ like being here?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mlle. Blanche'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: Yes, I thank you, Antonida Vassilievna.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I thank you, Antonida Vassilievna.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
And you, Potapitch, you go and tell that fool of a landlord to reserve
me a suitable suite of rooms. They must be handsomely decorated, and
not too high up. Have my luggage taken up to them. But what are you
tumbling over yourselves for? Why are you all tearing about? What
scullions these fellows are! Who is that with you?
subQuotationList:
['And you, Potapitch, you go and tell that fool of a landlord to reserve
me a suitable suite of rooms. They must be handsomely decorated, and
not too high up. Have my luggage taken up to them. But what are you
tumbling over yourselves for? Why are you all tearing about? What
scullions these fellows are! Who is that with you?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: A Mr. Astley,
subQuotationList: ['A Mr. Astley,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: And who is Mr. Astley?
subQuotationList: ['And who is Mr. Astley?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
A fellow-traveller, and my very good friend, as well as an
acquaintance of the General s.
subQuotationList: ['A fellow-traveller, and my very good friend, as well as an\nacquaintance of the General s.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Oh, an Englishman? Then that is why he stared at me without even
opening his lips. However, I like Englishmen. Now, take me upstairs,
direct to their rooms. Where are they lodging?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, an Englishman? Then that is why he stared at me without even\nopening his lips. However, I like Englishmen. Now, take me upstairs,\ndirect to their rooms. Where are they lodging?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText: She interests me tremendously,
subQuotationList: ['She interests me tremendously,']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Well, here I am and instead of a telegram, too! What? You were not
expecting me?
subQuotationList: ['Well, here I am and instead of a telegram, too!', 'What? You were not\nexpecting me?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Antonida Vassilievna! O my dearest mother! But how on earth did you,
did you ?
subQuotationList: ['Antonida Vassilievna! O my dearest mother! But how on earth did you,\ndid you ?']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
How on earth did I _what?_ Why, I just got into the
train and came here. What else is the railway meant for? But you
thought that I had turned up my toes and left my property to the lot of
you. Oh, I know _all_ about the telegrams which you have been
dispatching. They must have cost you a pretty sum, I should think, for
telegrams are not sent from abroad for nothing. Well, I picked up my
heels, and came here. Who is this Frenchman? Monsieur de Griers, I
suppose?
subQuotationList:
['How on earth did I _what?_', 'Why, I just got into the
train and came here. What else is the railway meant for? But you
thought that I had turned up my toes and left my property to the lot of

heels, and came here. Who is this Frenchman? Monsieur de Griers, I

speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Oui, madame, Et, croyez, je suis si enchant !
Votre sant  c est un miracle vous voir ici. Une surprise charmante!
subQuotationList: ['Oui, madame,', 'Et, croyez, je suis si enchant !\nVotre sant  c est un miracle vous voir ici. Une surprise charmante!']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Just so.  Charmante!  I happen to know you as a mountebank, and
therefore trust you no more than _this_. And who is _that?_ Who is that woman there?
subQuotationList: ['Just so.  Charmante!  I happen to know you as a mountebank, and\ntherefore trust you no more than _this_.', 'And who is _that?_', 'Who is that woman there?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Mlle. de Cominges, And this is her mother, Madame de
Cominges. They also are staying in the hotel.
subQuotationList: ['Mlle. de Cominges,', 'And this is her mother, Madame de\nCominges. They also are staying in the hotel.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Is the daughter married?
subQuotationList: ['Is the daughter married?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: No,
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Is she good company?
subQuotationList: ['Is she good company?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
I mean, is she or is she not a bore? Can she speak Russian? When this
De Griers was in Moscow he soon learnt to make himself understood.
subQuotationList: ['I mean, is she or is she not a bore? Can she speak Russian? When this\nDe Griers was in Moscow he soon learnt to make himself understood.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Bonjour, then,
subQuotationList: ['Bonjour, then,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Bonjour, madame,
subQuotationList: ['Bonjour, madame,']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: How the woman sticks out her eyes at me! How she mows and minces!
subQuotationList: ['How the woman sticks out her eyes at me! How she mows and minces!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
I have taken up my abode here, so am going to be your
next-door neighbour. Are you glad to hear that, or are you not?
subQuotationList: ['I have taken up my abode here, so am going to be your\nnext-door neighbour. Are you glad to hear that, or are you not?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
referringExpression: she turned suddenly to the General and continued

quoteText: My dear mother, believe me when I say that I am sincerely delighted,
subQuotationList: ['My dear mother, believe me when I say that I am sincerely delighted,']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
We have been so dismayed and upset by the
news of your indisposition! We had received such hopeless telegrams
about you! Then suddenly
subQuotationList: ['We have been so dismayed and upset by the\nnews of your indisposition! We had received such hopeless telegrams\nabout you! Then suddenly']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
referringExpression: he set himself to be expansive in his remarks and went on
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Fibs, fibs!
subQuotationList: ['Fibs, fibs!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
How on earth, too, did you come to decide upon the journey? Surely, at your age, and in your present state of health,
the thing is so unexpected that our surprise is at least intelligible.
However, I am glad to see you (as indeed, are we all and will use my best endeavours
to render your stay here as pleasant as possible.
subQuotationList:
['How on earth, too, did you come to decide upon the journey?', 'Surely, at your age, and in your present state of health,
the thing is so unexpected that our surprise is at least intelligible.
However, I am glad to see you (as indeed, are we all', 'and will use my best endeavours
to render your stay here as pleasant as possible.']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
Enough! All this is empty chatter. You are talking the usual nonsense.
I shall know quite well how to spend my time. How did I come to
undertake the journey, you ask? Well, is there anything so very
surprising about it? It was done quite simply. What is every one going
into ecstasies about? How do you do, Prascovia? What are _you_ doing
here?
subQuotationList:
['Enough! All this is empty chatter. You are talking the usual nonsense.
I shall know quite well how to spend my time. How did I come to
undertake the journey, you ask? Well, is there anything so very
surprising about it? It was done quite simply. What is every one going
into ecstasies about? How do you do, Prascovia? What are _you_ doing
here?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: And how are _you_, Grandmother? Were you long on the journey?
subQuotationList: ['And how are _you_, Grandmother?', 'Were you long on the journey?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
The most sensible question that I have yet been asked! Well, you shall
hear for yourself how it all happened. I lay and lay, and was doctored
and doctored, until at last I drove the physicians from me, and called
in an apothecary from Nicolai who had cured an old woman of a malady
similar to my own cured her merely with a little hayseed. Well, he did
me a great deal of good, for on the third day I broke into a sweat, and
was able to leave my bed. Then my German doctors held another
consultation, put on their spectacles, and told me that if I would go
abroad, and take a course of the waters, the indisposition would
finally pass away.  Why should it not?  I thought to myself. So I had
got things ready, and on the following day, a Friday, set out for here.
I occupied a special compartment in the train, and where ever I had to
change I found at the station bearers who were ready to carry me for a
few coppers. You have nice quarters here, But where on earth did you get the money for them, my
good sir? I thought that everything of yours had been mortgaged? This
Frenchman alone must be your creditor for a good deal. Oh, I know all
about it, all about it.
subQuotationList:
['The most sensible question that I have yet been asked! Well, you shall
hear for yourself how it all happened. I lay and lay, and was doctored
and doctored, until at last I drove the physicians from me, and called

I occupied a special compartment in the train, and where ever I had to
change I found at the station bearers who were ready to carry me for a
few coppers. You have nice quarters here,', 'But where on earth did you get the money for them, my
good sir? I thought that everything of yours had been mortgaged? This
Frenchman alone must be your creditor for a good deal. Oh, I know all
about it, all about it.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
