mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General']], [['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['The General']]]

quoteText:
I-I am surprised at you, my dearest mother, I-I am greatly surprised. But I do not need any extraneous
control of my finances. Moreover, my expenses do not exceed my income,
and we
subQuotationList: ['I-I am surprised at you, my dearest mother,', 'I-I am greatly surprised. But I do not need any extraneous\ncontrol of my finances. Moreover, my expenses do not exceed my income,\nand we']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
They do not exceed it? Fie! Why, you are robbing your children of
their last kopeck you, their guardian!
subQuotationList: ['They do not exceed it? Fie! Why, you are robbing your children of\ntheir last kopeck you, their guardian!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
After this, after what
you have just said, I do not know whether
subQuotationList: ['After this,', 'after what\nyou have just said, I do not know whether']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
You do not know _what?_ By heavens, are you _never_ going to drop that
roulette of yours? Are you going to whistle all your property away?
subQuotationList: ['You do not know _what?_ By heavens, are you _never_ going to drop that\nroulette of yours? Are you going to whistle all your property away?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Roulette, indeed? _I_ play roulette? Really, in view of my
position Recollect what you are saying, my dearest mother. You must
still be unwell.
subQuotationList: ['Roulette, indeed? _I_ play roulette? Really, in view of my\nposition Recollect what you are saying, my dearest mother. You must\nstill be unwell.']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Rubbish, rubbish!
subQuotationList: ['Rubbish, rubbish!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
The truth is that you _cannot_ be
got away from that roulette. You are simply telling lies. This very day
I mean to go and see for myself what roulette is like. Prascovia, tell
me what there is to be seen here; and do you, Alexis Ivanovitch, show
me everything; and do you, Potapitch, make me a list of excursions.
What _is_ there to be seen?
subQuotationList:
['The truth is that you _cannot_ be
got away from that roulette. You are simply telling lies. This very day
I mean to go and see for myself what roulette is like. Prascovia, tell
me what there is to be seen here; and do you, Alexis Ivanovitch, show
me everything; and do you, Potapitch, make me a list of excursions.
What _is_ there to be seen?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: There is a ruined castle, and the Shlangenberg.
subQuotationList: ['There is a ruined castle, and the Shlangenberg.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: The Shlangenberg? What is it? A forest?
subQuotationList: ['The Shlangenberg? What is it? A forest?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
No, a mountain on the summit of which there is a place fenced off.
From it you can get a most beautiful view.
subQuotationList: ['No, a mountain on the summit of which there is a place fenced off.\nFrom it you can get a most beautiful view.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Could a chair be carried up that mountain of yours?
subQuotationList: ['Could a chair be carried up that mountain of yours?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Doubtless we could find bearers for the purpose,
subQuotationList: ['Doubtless we could find bearers for the purpose,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
No, I _don t_ want to see them, I hate kissing
children, for their noses are always wet. How are you getting on,
Theodosia?
subQuotationList: ['No, I _don t_ want to see them,', 'I hate kissing\nchildren, for their noses are always wet. How are you getting on,\nTheodosia?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
I am very well, thank you, Madame, And how is
your ladyship? We have been feeling so anxious about you!
subQuotationList: ['I am very well, thank you, Madame,', 'And how is\nyour ladyship? We have been feeling so anxious about you!']
speaker: Theodosia
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
Yes, I know, you simple soul But who are those other guests? For instance, who is that old
rascal in the spectacles?
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I know, you simple soul But who are those other guests?', 'For instance, who is that old\nrascal in the spectacles?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Prince Nilski, Grandmamma,
subQuotationList: ['Prince Nilski, Grandmamma,']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
Oh, a Russian? Why, I had no idea that he could understand me! Surely
he did not hear what I said? As for Mr. Astley, I have seen him
already, and I see that he is here again. How do you do?
subQuotationList: ['Oh, a Russian? Why, I had no idea that he could understand me! Surely\nhe did not hear what I said? As for Mr. Astley, I have seen him\nalready, and I see that he is here again. How do you do?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
referringExpression: she added to the gentleman in question

quoteText:
Have you _nothing_ to say to me? Say
something, for goodness  sake! Translate to him, Polina.
subQuotationList: ['Have you _nothing_ to say to me?', 'Say\nsomething, for goodness  sake! Translate to him, Polina.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: I have only to say, that I am indeed glad to see you in such good health.
subQuotationList: ['I have only to say,', 'that I am indeed glad to see you in such good health.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: How well English people know how to answer one!
subQuotationList: ['How well English people know how to answer one!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
That
is why I like them so much better than French. Come here,
subQuotationList: ['That\nis why I like them so much better than French. Come here,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
I will try not to bore you too much. Polina, translate to
him that I am staying in rooms on a lower floor. Yes, on a lower
floor,
subQuotationList: ['I will try not to bore you too much. Polina, translate to\nhim that I am staying in rooms on a lower floor. Yes, on a lower\nfloor,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
I could almost have liked you, Prascovia, for
you are a nice girl the best of the lot. You have some character about
you. I too have character. Turn round. Surely that is not false hair
that you are wearing?
subQuotationList:
['I could almost have liked you, Prascovia,', 'for
you are a nice girl the best of the lot. You have some character about
you. I too have character. Turn round. Surely that is not false hair
that you are wearing?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']], [['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText: No, Grandmamma. It is my own.
subQuotationList: ['No, Grandmamma. It is my own.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Well, well. I do not like the stupid fashions of today. You are very
good looking. I should have fallen in love with you if I had been a
man. Why do you not get married? It is time now that I was going. I
want to walk, yet I always have to ride. Are you still in a bad
temper?
subQuotationList:
['Well, well. I do not like the stupid fashions of today. You are very
good looking. I should have fallen in love with you if I had been a
man. Why do you not get married? It is time now that I was going. I
want to walk, yet I always have to ride. Are you still in a bad
temper?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: No, indeed,
subQuotationList: ['No, indeed,']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: I quite understand that at your time of life
subQuotationList: ['I quite understand that at your time of life']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Cette vieille est tomb e en enfance,
subQuotationList: ['Cette vieille est tomb e en enfance,']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText: But I want to look round a little, Will you lend me Alexis Ivanovitch for the purpose?
subQuotationList: ['But I want to look round a little,', 'Will you lend me Alexis Ivanovitch for the purpose?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
referringExpression: the old lady added to the General

quoteText:
As much as you like. But I myself yes, and Polina and Monsieur de
Griers too we all of us hope to have the pleasure of escorting you.
subQuotationList: ['As much as you like. But I myself yes, and Polina and Monsieur de\nGriers too we all of us hope to have the pleasure of escorting you.']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Mais, madame, cela sera un plaisir,
subQuotationList: ['Mais, madame, cela sera un plaisir,']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Plaisir  indeed! Why, I look upon you as a perfect fool, monsieur. I am not going to let you have any
of my money. I must be off to my rooms now, to see what they are like.
Afterwards we will look round a little. Lift me up.
subQuotationList: ['Plaisir  indeed! Why, I look upon you as a perfect fool, monsieur.', 'I am not going to let you have any\nof my money. I must be off to my rooms now, to see what they are like.\nAfterwards we will look round a little. Lift me up.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Theodosia', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']], [['The General'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: Of whom is this a portrait?
subQuotationList: ['Of whom is this a portrait?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: But how know you that?
subQuotationList: ['But how know you that?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
You live here, yet you cannot say for certain! And why is the picture
there at all? And why do its eyes look so crooked?
subQuotationList: ['You live here, yet you cannot say for certain! And why is the picture\nthere at all? And why do its eyes look so crooked?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: The blockhead!
subQuotationList: ['The blockhead!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: What donkeys these people are!
subQuotationList: ['What donkeys these people are!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: What a huge counterpane! Turn it back, please.
subQuotationList: ['What a huge counterpane!', 'Turn it back, please.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Further yet, further yet, Turn it _right_ back.
Also, take off those pillows and bolsters, and lift up the feather
bed.
subQuotationList: ['Further yet, further yet,', 'Turn it _right_ back.\nAlso, take off those pillows and bolsters, and lift up the feather\nbed.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Mercifully it contains no bugs,
subQuotationList: ['Mercifully it contains no bugs,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Pull off the whole thing, and then put on my own pillows and sheets.
The place is too luxurious for an old woman like myself. It is too
large for any one person. Alexis Ivanovitch, come and see me whenever
you are not teaching your pupils.
subQuotationList:
['Pull off the whole thing, and then put on my own pillows and sheets.
The place is too luxurious for an old woman like myself. It is too
large for any one person. Alexis Ivanovitch, come and see me whenever
you are not teaching your pupils.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: After tomorrow I shall no longer be in the General s service, but merely living in the hotel on my own account.
subQuotationList: ['After tomorrow I shall no longer be in the General s service,', 'but merely living in the hotel on my own account.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Why so?
subQuotationList: ['Why so?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Because, the other day, there arrived from Berlin a German and his
wife persons of some importance; and, it chanced that, when taking a
walk, I spoke to them in German without having properly compassed the
Berlin accent.
subQuotationList:
['Because, the other day, there arrived from Berlin a German and his
wife persons of some importance; and, it chanced that, when taking a
walk, I spoke to them in German without having properly compassed the
Berlin accent.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Indeed?
subQuotationList: ['Indeed?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Yes: and this action on my part the Baron held to be an insult, and
complained about it to the General, who yesterday dismissed me from his
employ.
subQuotationList: ['Yes: and this action on my part the Baron held to be an insult, and\ncomplained about it to the General, who yesterday dismissed me from his\nemploy.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
But I suppose you must have threatened that precious Baron, or
something of the kind? However, even if you did so, it was a matter of
no moment.
subQuotationList: ['But I suppose you must have threatened that precious Baron, or\nsomething of the kind? However, even if you did so, it was a matter of\nno moment.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
No, I did not. The Baron was the aggressor by raising his stick at
me.
subQuotationList: ['No, I did not. The Baron was the aggressor by raising his stick at\nme.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
What? You permitted yourself to treat your tutor thus, you nincompoop,
and to dismiss him from his post? You are a blockhead an utter
blockhead! I can see that clearly.
subQuotationList: ['What? You permitted yourself to treat your tutor thus, you nincompoop,\nand to dismiss him from his post? You are a blockhead an utter\nblockhead! I can see that clearly.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General']]]

quoteText:
Do not alarm yourself, my dear mother, I am
quite capable of managing my own affairs. Moreover, Alexis Ivanovitch
has not given you a true account of the matter.
subQuotationList: ['Do not alarm yourself, my dear mother,', 'I am\nquite capable of managing my own affairs. Moreover, Alexis Ivanovitch\nhas not given you a true account of the matter.']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: What did you do next?
subQuotationList: ['What did you do next?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
referringExpression: The old lady inquired of me

quoteText: I wanted to challenge the Baron to a duel, but the General protested against my doing so.
subQuotationList: ['I wanted to challenge the Baron to a duel,', 'but the General protested against my doing so.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: And _why_ did you so protest?
subQuotationList: ['And _why_ did you so protest?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
For, I can see no
difference between you and the Baron; nor can I bear that German visage
of yours.
subQuotationList: ['For,', 'I can see no\ndifference between you and the Baron; nor can I bear that German visage\nof yours.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Pardon me, Madame, but are duels
really feasible?
subQuotationList: ['Pardon me, Madame,', 'but are duels\nreally feasible?']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
Why not? All men are crowing cocks, and that is why they quarrel.
_You_, though, I perceive, are a blockhead a man who does not even know
how to carry his breeding. Lift me up. Potapitch, see to it that you
always have _two_ bearers ready. Go and arrange for their hire. But we
shall not require more than two, for I shall need only to be carried
upstairs. On the level or in the street I can be _wheeled_ along. Go
and tell them that, and pay them in advance, so that they may show me
some respect. You too, Potapitch, are always to come with me, and
_you_, Alexis Ivanovitch, are to point out to me this Baron as we go
along, in order that I may get a squint at the precious  Von.  And
where is that roulette played?
subQuotationList:
['Why not? All men are crowing cocks, and that is why they quarrel.
_You_, though, I perceive, are a blockhead a man who does not even know
how to carry his breeding. Lift me up. Potapitch, see to it that you
always have _two_ bearers ready. Go and arrange for their hire. But we
shall not require more than two, for I shall need only to be carried
upstairs. On the level or in the street I can be _wheeled_ along. Go
and tell them that, and pay them in advance, so that they may show me
some respect. You too, Potapitch, are always to come with me, and
_you_, Alexis Ivanovitch, are to point out to me this Baron as we go
along, in order that I may get a squint at the precious  Von.  And
where is that roulette played?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General'], ['Potapitch'], ['Potapitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'The General'], ['Potapitch'], ['Potapitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The Baron'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
Then take me straight there, and do you walk on in front
of me, Alexis Ivanovitch.
subQuotationList: ['Then take me straight there,', 'and do you walk on in front\nof me, Alexis Ivanovitch.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: What, mother? Before you have so much as rested from your journey?
subQuotationList: ['What, mother? Before you have so much as rested from your journey?']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
Why should I rest? I am not tired, for I have been
sitting still these past five days. Let us see what your medicinal
springs and waters are like, and where they are situated. What, too,
about that, that what did you call it, Prascovia? oh, about that
mountain top?
subQuotationList:
['Why should I rest?', 'I am not tired, for I have been
sitting still these past five days. Let us see what your medicinal
springs and waters are like, and where they are situated. What, too,
about that, that what did you call it, Prascovia? oh, about that
mountain top?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The General', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText: Yes, we are going to see it, Grandmamma.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, we are going to see it, Grandmamma.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Very well. Is there anything else for me to see here?
subQuotationList: ['Very well. Is there anything else for me to see here?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Yes! Quite a number of things,
subQuotationList: ['Yes! Quite a number of things,']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: Martha, _you_ must come with me as well,
subQuotationList: ['Martha, _you_ must come with me as well,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
referringExpression: went on the old lady to her maid

quoteText:
No, no, mother! Really she cannot come. They
would not admit even Potapitch to the Casino.
subQuotationList: ['No, no, mother!', 'Really she cannot come. They\nwould not admit even Potapitch to the Casino.']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
Rubbish! Because she is my servant, is that a reason for turning her
out? Why, she is only a human being like the rest of us; and as she has
been travelling for a week she might like to look about her. With whom
else could she go out but myself? She would never dare to show her nose
in the street alone.
subQuotationList:
['Rubbish! Because she is my servant, is that a reason for turning her
out? Why, she is only a human being like the rest of us; and as she has
been travelling for a week she might like to look about her. With whom
else could she go out but myself? She would never dare to show her nose
in the street alone.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: But, mother
subQuotationList: ['But, mother']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
Are you ashamed to be seen with me? Stop at home, then, and you will
be asked no questions. A pretty General _you_ are, to be sure! I am a
general s widow myself. But, after all, why should I drag the whole
party with me? I will go and see the sights with only Alexis Ivanovitch
as my escort.
subQuotationList:
['Are you ashamed to be seen with me? Stop at home, then, and you will
be asked no questions. A pretty General _you_ are, to be sure! I am a
general s widow myself. But, after all, why should I drag the whole
party with me? I will go and see the sights with only Alexis Ivanovitch
as my escort.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Mais elle est tomb e en enfance, Seule, elle fera des b tises.
subQuotationList: ['Mais elle est tomb e en enfance,', 'Seule, elle fera des b tises.']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
referringExpression: he added aside to the General

quoteText:
Who
was it passed just now? Who is that coming along? Is the town a
large one? Are the public gardens extensive? What sort of trees are
those? What is the name of those hills? Do I see eagles flying
yonder? What is that absurd-looking building?
subQuotationList:
['Who
was it passed just now?', 'Who is that coming along?', 'Is the town a
large one?', 'Are the public gardens extensive?', 'What sort of trees are
those?', 'What is the name of those hills?', 'Do I see eagles flying
yonder?', 'What is that absurd-looking building?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']
referringExpression: Polina had to answer an endless flow of petty questions

quoteText: I am not going to give you any of my money;
subQuotationList: ['I am not going to give you any of my money;']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']

quoteText:
Go and tell him, go and tell him to stop, and to take his money with him, and go home.
Presently he will be losing yes, losing everything that he has now
won.
subQuotationList: ['Go and tell him,', 'go and tell him to stop, and to take his money with him, and go home.\nPresently he will be losing yes, losing everything that he has now\nwon.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Where is Potapitch?
subQuotationList: ['Where is Potapitch?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Send Potapitch to speak to him.
No, _you_ must tell him, _you_ must tell him, for I have not the least notion where Potapitch is. Sortez,
sortez,
subQuotationList: ['Send Potapitch to speak to him.\nNo, _you_ must tell him, _you_ must tell him,', 'for I have not the least notion where Potapitch is. Sortez,\nsortez,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
referringExpression: she shouted to the young man

quoteText:
How provoking! Then the young man is done for! I
suppose he _wishes_ to be ruined. Yet I could not bear to see him have
to return it all. What a fool the fellow is!
subQuotationList: ['How provoking!', 'Then the young man is done for! I\nsuppose he _wishes_ to be ruined. Yet I could not bear to see him have\nto return it all. What a fool the fellow is!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
_That_ woman is not losing, To whom does she belong? Do
you know her? Who is she?
subQuotationList: ['_That_ woman is not losing,', 'To whom does she belong? Do\nyou know her? Who is she?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: She is, I believe, a Frenchwoman,
subQuotationList: ['She is, I believe, a Frenchwoman,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Ah! A bird of passage, evidently. Besides, I can see that she has her
shoes polished. Now, explain to me the meaning of each round in the
game, and the way in which one ought to stake.
subQuotationList: ['Ah! A bird of passage, evidently. Besides, I can see that she has her\nshoes polished. Now, explain to me the meaning of each round in the\ngame, and the way in which one ought to stake.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
But what is zero? Just now I heard the flaxen-haired
croupier call out  zero!  And why does he keep raking in all the money
that is on the table? To think that he should grab the whole pile for
himself! What does zero mean?
subQuotationList:
['But what is zero?', 'Just now I heard the flaxen-haired
croupier call out  zero!  And why does he keep raking in all the money
that is on the table? To think that he should grab the whole pile for
himself! What does zero mean?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Zero is what the bank takes for itself. If the wheel stops at that
figure, everything lying on the table becomes the absolute property of
the bank. Also, whenever the wheel has begun to turn, the bank ceases
to pay out anything.
subQuotationList:
['Zero is what the bank takes for itself. If the wheel stops at that
figure, everything lying on the table becomes the absolute property of
the bank. Also, whenever the wheel has begun to turn, the bank ceases
to pay out anything.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Then I should receive nothing if I were staking?
subQuotationList: ['Then I should receive nothing if I were staking?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
No; unless by any chance you had _purposely_ staked on zero; in which
case you would receive thirty-five times the value of your stake.
subQuotationList: ['No; unless by any chance you had _purposely_ staked on zero; in which\ncase you would receive thirty-five times the value of your stake.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Why thirty-five times, when zero so often turns up? And if so, why do
not more of these fools stake upon it?
subQuotationList: ['Why thirty-five times, when zero so often turns up? And if so, why do\nnot more of these fools stake upon it?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Because the number of chances against its occurrence is thirty-six.
subQuotationList: ['Because the number of chances against its occurrence is thirty-six.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Rubbish! Potapitch, Potapitch! Come here, and I will give you some
money.
subQuotationList: ['Rubbish! Potapitch, Potapitch! Come here, and I will give you some\nmoney.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Go at once, and
stake that upon zero.
subQuotationList: ['Go at once, and\nstake that upon zero.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
But, Madame, zero has only this moment turned up, wherefore, it may not do so again for ever so long. Wait a little, and
you may then have a better chance.
subQuotationList: ['But, Madame, zero has only this moment turned up,', 'wherefore, it may not do so again for ever so long. Wait a little, and\nyou may then have a better chance.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Rubbish! Stake, please.
subQuotationList: ['Rubbish! Stake, please.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Pardon me, but zero might not turn up again until, say, tonight, even
though you had staked thousands upon it. It often happens so.
subQuotationList: ['Pardon me, but zero might not turn up again until, say, tonight, even\nthough you had staked thousands upon it. It often happens so.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Rubbish, rubbish! Who fears the wolf should never enter the forest.
What? We have lost? Then stake again.
subQuotationList: ['Rubbish, rubbish! Who fears the wolf should never enter the forest.\nWhat? We have lost? Then stake again.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Trente-six,
subQuotationList: ['Trente-six,']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText:
To listen to him! When will that accursed zero
ever turn up? I cannot breathe until I see it. I believe that that
infernal croupier is _purposely_ keeping it from turning up. Alexis
Ivanovitch, stake TWO golden pieces this time. The moment we cease to
stake, that cursed zero will come turning up, and we shall get
nothing.
subQuotationList:
['To listen to him!', 'When will that accursed zero
ever turn up? I cannot breathe until I see it. I believe that that
infernal croupier is _purposely_ keeping it from turning up. Alexis
Ivanovitch, stake TWO golden pieces this time. The moment we cease to
stake, that cursed zero will come turning up, and we shall get
nothing.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The Croupier']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: My good Madame
subQuotationList: ['My good Madame']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Stake, stake! It is not _your_ money.
subQuotationList: ['Stake, stake! It is not _your_ money.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Zero!
subQuotationList: ['Zero!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText:
There! You see, you see! I told you so! It was the Lord God himself who
suggested to me to stake those two coins. Now, how much ought I to
receive? Why do they not pay it out to me? Potapitch! Martha! Where are
they? What has become of our party? Potapitch, Potapitch!
subQuotationList:
['There! You see, you see!', 'I told you so! It was the Lord God himself who
suggested to me to stake those two coins. Now, how much ought I to
receive? Why do they not pay it out to me? Potapitch! Martha! Where are
they? What has become of our party? Potapitch, Potapitch!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Potapitch'], ['Martha'], ['Martha', 'Potapitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Mr. Astley', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'The General'], ['Potapitch'], ['Potapitch']]]

quoteText:
Presently, Madame, Potapitch is outside, and they would
decline to admit him to these rooms. See! You are being paid out your
money. Pray take it.
subQuotationList: ['Presently, Madame,', 'Potapitch is outside, and they would\ndecline to admit him to these rooms. See! You are being paid out your\nmoney. Pray take it.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Potapitch'], ['Potapitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Faites le jeu, messieurs! Faites le jeu, messieurs! Rien ne va plus,
subQuotationList: ['Faites le jeu, messieurs! Faites le jeu, messieurs! Rien ne va plus,']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText: We shall be too late! He is going to spin again! Stake, stake!
subQuotationList: ['We shall be too late! He is going to spin again! Stake, stake!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Do not hang back! Be quick!
subQuotationList: ['Do not hang back! Be quick!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Upon what shall I stake, Madame?
subQuotationList: ['Upon what shall I stake, Madame?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Upon zero, upon zero! Again upon zero! Stake as much as ever you can.
How much have we got? Seventy ten-g lden pieces? We shall not miss
them, so stake twenty pieces at a time.
subQuotationList: ['Upon zero, upon zero! Again upon zero! Stake as much as ever you can.\nHow much have we got? Seventy ten-g lden pieces? We shall not miss\nthem, so stake twenty pieces at a time.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Think a moment, Madame. Sometimes zero does not turn up for two
hundred rounds in succession. I assure you that you may lose all your
capital.
subQuotationList: ['Think a moment, Madame. Sometimes zero does not turn up for two\nhundred rounds in succession. I assure you that you may lose all your\ncapital.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
You are wrong utterly wrong. Stake, I tell you! What a chattering
tongue you have! I know perfectly well what I am doing.
subQuotationList: ['You are wrong utterly wrong. Stake, I tell you! What a chattering\ntongue you have! I know perfectly well what I am doing.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
But the rules do not allow of more than 120 g lden being staked upon
zero at a time.
subQuotationList: ['But the rules do not allow of more than 120 g lden being staked upon\nzero at a time.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: How  do not allow ? Surely you are wrong? Monsieur, monsieur
subQuotationList: ['How  do not allow ? Surely you are wrong? Monsieur, monsieur']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: combien zero? Douze? Douze?
subQuotationList: ['combien zero? Douze? Douze?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Oui, Madame, No single stake must
exceed four thousand florins. That is the regulation.
subQuotationList: ['Oui, Madame,', 'No single stake must\nexceed four thousand florins. That is the regulation.']
speaker: The Croupier
referringExpression: was the croupier s polite reply

quoteText: Then there is nothing else for it. We must risk in g lden.
subQuotationList: ['Then there is nothing else for it. We must risk in g lden.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Le jeu est fait!
subQuotationList: ['Le jeu est fait!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText: Again, again, again! Stake again!
subQuotationList: ['Again, again, again! Stake again!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Does she again think that zero is going to be the winning coup?
subQuotationList: ['Does she again think that zero is going to be the winning coup?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Zero!
subQuotationList: ['Zero!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText: Ah!!!
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Alexis Ivanovitch, did not the croupier just say that 4000 florins
were the most that could be staked at any one time? Well, take these
4000, and stake them upon the red.
subQuotationList: ['Alexis Ivanovitch, did not the croupier just say that 4000 florins\nwere the most that could be staked at any one time? Well, take these\n4000, and stake them upon the red.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Rouge!
subQuotationList: ['Rouge!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText:
Give me them, and stake the other 4000
upon the red again.
subQuotationList: ['Give me them,', 'and stake the other 4000\nupon the red again.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Rouge!
subQuotationList: ['Rouge!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText:
Twelve thousand! Hand me the whole lot. Put the
gold into this purse here, and count the bank notes. Enough! Let us go
home. Wheel my chair away.
subQuotationList: ['Twelve thousand!', 'Hand me the whole lot. Put the\ngold into this purse here, and count the bank notes. Enough! Let us go\nhome. Wheel my chair away.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Quelle victoire!
subQuotationList: ['Quelle victoire!']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man']

quoteText: Mais, Madame, c  tait du feu!
subQuotationList: ['Mais, Madame, c  tait du feu!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man']

quoteText:
Yes, I have won twelve thousand florins, And
then there is all this gold. With it the total ought to come to nearly
thirteen thousand. How much is that in Russian money? Six thousand
roubles, I think?
subQuotationList:
['Yes, I have won twelve thousand florins,', 'And
then there is all this gold. With it the total ought to come to nearly
thirteen thousand. How much is that in Russian money? Six thousand
roubles, I think?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man']

quoteText:
Eight thousand roubles! What a splendid thing! And to think of you
simpletons sitting there and doing nothing! Potapitch! Martha! See what
I have won!
subQuotationList: ['Eight thousand roubles! What a splendid thing! And to think of you\nsimpletons sitting there and doing nothing! Potapitch! Martha! See what\nI have won!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
How _did_ you do it, Madame? Eight
thousand roubles!
subQuotationList: ['How _did_ you do it, Madame?', 'Eight\nthousand roubles!']
speaker: Martha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: And I am going to give you fifty g lden apiece. There they are.
subQuotationList: ['And I am going to give you fifty g lden apiece. There they are.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
And to each bearer also I will give a ten-g lden piece. Let them have
it out of the gold, Alexis Ivanovitch. But why is this footman bowing
to me, and that other man as well? Are they congratulating me? Well,
let them have ten g lden apiece.
subQuotationList:
['And to each bearer also I will give a ten-g lden piece. Let them have
it out of the gold, Alexis Ivanovitch. But why is this footman bowing
to me, and that other man as well? Are they congratulating me? Well,
let them have ten g lden apiece.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
Madame la princesse Un pauvre expatri  Malheur continuel Les princes
russes sont si g n reux!
subQuotationList: ['Madame la princesse Un pauvre expatri  Malheur continuel Les princes\nrusses sont si g n reux!']
speaker: A Man
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
Give him ten g lden, No, give him twenty. Now,
enough of that, or I shall never get done with you all. Take a moment s
rest, and then carry me away. Prascovia, I mean to buy a new dress for
you tomorrow. Yes, and for you too, Mlle. Blanche. Please translate,
Prascovia.
subQuotationList:
['Give him ten g lden,', 'No, give him twenty. Now,
enough of that, or I shall never get done with you all. Take a moment s
rest, and then carry me away. Prascovia, I mean to buy a new dress for
you tomorrow. Yes, and for you too, Mlle. Blanche. Please translate,
Prascovia.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'A Man', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['A Man']], [['A Man'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText: Merci, Madame,
subQuotationList: ['Merci, Madame,']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
How surprised Theodosia too will be! She, like yourselves, shall
have the price of a new gown. Here, Alexis Ivanovitch! Give that beggar
something
subQuotationList: ['How surprised Theodosia too will be!', 'She, like yourselves, shall\nhave the price of a new gown. Here, Alexis Ivanovitch! Give that beggar\nsomething']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: But perhaps he is _not_ a beggar only a rascal,
subQuotationList: ['But perhaps he is _not_ a beggar only a rascal,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Never mind, never mind. Give him a g lden.
subQuotationList: ['Never mind, never mind. Give him a g lden.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: Have you never tried your luck, Alexis Ivanovitch?
subQuotationList: ['Have you never tried your luck, Alexis Ivanovitch?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: No, Madame.
subQuotationList: ['No, Madame.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Yet just now I could see that you were burning to do so?
subQuotationList: ['Yet just now I could see that you were burning to do so?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: I _do_ mean to try my luck presently.
subQuotationList: ['I _do_ mean to try my luck presently.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Then stake everything upon zero. You have seen how it ought to be
done? How much capital do you possess?
subQuotationList: ['Then stake everything upon zero. You have seen how it ought to be\ndone? How much capital do you possess?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: Two hundred g lden, Madame.
subQuotationList: ['Two hundred g lden, Madame.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
Not very much. See here; I will lend you five hundred if you wish.
Take this purse of mine. But _you_ need not expect to receive any.
subQuotationList: ['Not very much. See here; I will lend you five hundred if you wish.\nTake this purse of mine.', 'But _you_ need not expect to receive any.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']
referringExpression: she added sharply to the General

quoteText:
Que diable! C est une terrible
vieille.
subQuotationList: ['Que diable!', 'C est une terrible\nvieille.']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText: Look! Another beggar, another beggar! Alexis Ivanovitch, go and give him a g lden.
subQuotationList: ['Look! Another beggar, another beggar!', 'Alexis Ivanovitch, go and give him a g lden.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: Was ist der Teufel!
subQuotationList: ['Was ist der Teufel!']
speaker: A Grey-headed Old Man
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
The man is a perfect fool! Move on now, for I am simply famished. When we have lunched we
will return to that place.
subQuotationList: ['The man is a perfect fool!', 'Move on now, for I am simply famished. When we have lunched we\nwill return to that place.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['A Grey-headed Old Man']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: What? You are going to play _again?_
subQuotationList: ['What?', 'You are going to play _again?_']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText:
What else do you suppose? Are you going only to sit
here, and grow sour, and let me look at you?
subQuotationList: ['What else do you suppose?', 'Are you going only to sit\nhere, and grow sour, and let me look at you?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
Madame, les chances peuvent tourner.
Une seule mauvaise chance, et vous perdrez tout surtout avec votre jeu.
C  tait terrible!
subQuotationList: ['Madame,', 'les chances peuvent tourner.\nUne seule mauvaise chance, et vous perdrez tout surtout avec votre jeu.\nC  tait terrible!']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: Oui; vous perdrez absolument,
subQuotationList: ['Oui; vous perdrez absolument,']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: What has that got to do with _you?_
subQuotationList: ['What has that got to do with _you?_']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
It is not
_your_ money that I am going to lose; it is my own. And where is that
Mr. Astley of yours?
subQuotationList: ['It is not\n_your_ money that I am going to lose; it is my own. And where is that\nMr. Astley of yours?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: He stayed behind in the Casino.
subQuotationList: ['He stayed behind in the Casino.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Martha', 'Potapitch']

quoteText: What a pity! He is such a nice sort of man!
subQuotationList: ['What a pity! He is such a nice sort of man!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText:
I was watching you all the time, Madame, and I
asked Potapitch what mistress was trying to do. And, my word! the heaps
and _heaps_ of money that were lying upon the table! Never in my life
have I seen so much money. And there were gentlefolk around it, and
other gentlefolk sitting down. So, I asked Potapitch where all these
gentry had come from; for, thought I, maybe the Holy Mother of God will
help our mistress among them. Yes, I prayed for you, Madame, and my
heart died within me, so that I kept trembling and trembling. The Lord
be with her, I thought to myself; and in answer to my prayer He has now
sent you what He has done! Even yet I tremble I tremble to think of it
all.
subQuotationList:
['I was watching you all the time, Madame,', 'and I
asked Potapitch what mistress was trying to do. And, my word! the heaps
and _heaps_ of money that were lying upon the table! Never in my life
have I seen so much money. And there were gentlefolk around it, and
other gentlefolk sitting down. So, I asked Potapitch where all these
gentry had come from; for, thought I, maybe the Holy Mother of God will
help our mistress among them. Yes, I prayed for you, Madame, and my
heart died within me, so that I kept trembling and trembling. The Lord
be with her, I thought to myself; and in answer to my prayer He has now
sent you what He has done! Even yet I tremble I tremble to think of it
all.']
speaker: Martha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Potapitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Potapitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
Alexis Ivanovitch, after luncheon, that is to
say, about four o clock get ready to go out with me again. But in the
meanwhile, good-bye. Do not forget to call a doctor, for I must take
the waters. Now go and get rested a little.
subQuotationList:
['Alexis Ivanovitch,', 'after luncheon, that is to
say, about four o clock get ready to go out with me again. But in the
meanwhile, good-bye. Do not forget to call a doctor, for I must take
the waters. Now go and get rested a little.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Good Lord! every ten-g lden piece which the Grandmother staked must have
raised a blister on the General s heart, and maddened De Griers, and
driven Mlle. de Cominges almost to frenzy with the sight of this spoon
dangling before her lips.
subQuotationList:
['Good Lord!', 'every ten-g lden piece which the Grandmother staked must have
raised a blister on the General s heart, and maddened De Griers, and
driven Mlle. de Cominges almost to frenzy with the sight of this spoon
dangling before her lips.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche']]]

quoteText: Polina Alexandrovna!
subQuotationList: ['Polina Alexandrovna!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Hush! Not so loud.
subQuotationList: ['Hush! Not so loud.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
Something startled me just now, and I looked round, and
saw you. Some electrical influence seems to emanate from your form.
subQuotationList: ['Something startled me just now,', 'and I looked round, and\nsaw you. Some electrical influence seems to emanate from your form.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Take this letter, and hand it personally to Mr.
Astley. Go as quickly as ever you can, please. No answer will be
required. He himself
subQuotationList: ['Take this letter,', 'and hand it personally to Mr.\nAstley. Go as quickly as ever you can, please. No answer will be\nrequired. He himself']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: To Mr. Astley?
subQuotationList: ['To Mr. Astley?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: My friend, mine own familiar friend!
subQuotationList: ['My friend, mine own familiar friend!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Alexis Ivanovitch, may I say to you that I find it strange, exceedingly
strange, that In short, your conduct towards myself and my family  In a
word, your er extremely
subQuotationList: ['Alexis Ivanovitch,', 'may I say to you that I find it strange, exceedingly\nstrange, that In short, your conduct towards myself and my family  In a\nword, your er extremely']
speaker: The General
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Eh! Ce n est pas  a, Mon
cher monsieur, notre g n ral se trompe. What he means to say is that he
warns you he begs of you most earnestly not to ruin him. I use the
expression because
subQuotationList:
['Eh! Ce n est pas  a,', 'Mon
cher monsieur, notre g n ral se trompe. What he means to say is that he
warns you he begs of you most earnestly not to ruin him. I use the
expression because']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['The General'], ['The General'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General']]]

quoteText: Why? Why?
subQuotationList: ['Why? Why?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Because you have taken upon yourself to act as guide to this, to
this how shall I express it? to this old lady,   cette pauvre terrible
vieille. But she will only gamble away all that she has gamble it away
like thistledown. You yourself have seen her play. Once she has
acquired the taste for gambling, she will never leave the
roulette-table, but, of sheer perversity and temper, will stake her
all, and lose it. In cases such as hers a gambler can never be torn
away from the game; and then and then
subQuotationList:
['Because you have taken upon yourself to act as guide to this, to
this how shall I express it? to this old lady,   cette pauvre terrible
vieille. But she will only gamble away all that she has gamble it away
like thistledown. You yourself have seen her play. Once she has
acquired the taste for gambling, she will never leave the
roulette-table, but, of sheer perversity and temper, will stake her
all, and lose it. In cases such as hers a gambler can never be torn
away from the game; and then and then']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
And then, you will have ruined my whole
family. I and my family are her heirs, for she has no nearer relatives
than ourselves. I tell you frankly that my affairs are in great very
great disorder; how much they are so you yourself are partially aware.
If she should lose a large sum, or, maybe, her whole fortune, what will
become of us of my children or of me? Alexis Ivanovitch, I beg of you to save
us.
subQuotationList:
['And then,', 'you will have ruined my whole
family. I and my family are her heirs, for she has no nearer relatives
than ourselves. I tell you frankly that my affairs are in great very
great disorder; how much they are so you yourself are partially aware.
If she should lose a large sum, or, maybe, her whole fortune, what will
become of us of my children', 'or of me?', 'Alexis Ivanovitch, I beg of you to save
us.']
speaker: The General
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna', 'Mlle.
