Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers']], [], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Tell me, General, how am I to do so? On what footing do I stand here?
subQuotationList: ['Tell me, General, how am I to do so? On what footing do I stand here?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Refuse to take her about. Simply leave her alone.
subQuotationList: ['Refuse to take her about. Simply leave her alone.']
speaker: The General

quoteText: But she would soon find some one else to take my place?
subQuotationList: ['But she would soon find some one else to take my place?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Ce n est pas  a, ce n est pas  a, Que
diable! Do not leave her alone so much as advise her, persuade her,
draw her away. In any case do not let her gamble; find her some
counter-attraction.
subQuotationList:
['Ce n est pas  a, ce n est pas  a,', 'Que
diable! Do not leave her alone so much as advise her, persuade her,
draw her away. In any case do not let her gamble; find her some
counter-attraction.']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
And how am I to do that? If only you would undertake the task,
Monsieur de Griers!
subQuotationList: ['And how am I to do that? If only you would undertake the task,\nMonsieur de Griers!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Well, at the present moment she would refuse to accept my services, But if, later
subQuotationList: ['Well, at the present moment she would refuse to accept my services,', 'But if, later']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
Alexis Ivanovitch, pray pardon me for having said what I
did just now for having said more than I meant to do. I beg and beseech
you, I kiss the hem of your garment, as our Russian saying has it, for
you, and only you, can save us. I and Mlle. de Cominges, we all of us
beg of you But you understand, do you not? Surely you understand?
subQuotationList:
['Alexis Ivanovitch,', 'pray pardon me for having said what I
did just now for having said more than I meant to do. I beg and beseech
you, I kiss the hem of your garment, as our Russian saying has it, for
you, and only you, can save us. I and Mlle. de Cominges, we all of us
beg of you But you understand, do you not? Surely you understand?']
speaker: The General
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: She is in a bad humour,
subQuotationList: ['She is in a bad humour,']
speaker: Potapitch

quoteText:
My mistress was unable to sleep, so, after
tossing about for a while, she suddenly rose, called for her chair, and
sent me to look for you. She is now in the verandah.
subQuotationList: ['My mistress was unable to sleep,', 'so, after\ntossing about for a while, she suddenly rose, called for her chair, and\nsent me to look for you. She is now in the verandah.']
speaker: Potapitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Quelle m g re!
subQuotationList: ['Quelle m g re!']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText: Lift me up,
subQuotationList: ['Lift me up,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
What
was that?
subQuotationList: ['What\nwas that?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
referringExpression: she lifted her hand for a moment and inquired

quoteText: Ah!
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
referringExpression: she merely looked at them in an absentminded sort of way and said

quoteText:
Why have _you_ attached yourselves to the party? We are not going to
take you with us every time. Go home at once.
subQuotationList: ['Why have _you_ attached yourselves to the party? We are not going to\ntake you with us every time. Go home at once.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
You are all the
escort I need.
subQuotationList: ['You are all the\nescort I need.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Stake again,
subQuotationList: ['Stake again,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: How many times have we lost?
subQuotationList: ['How many times have we lost?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
We have lost 144 ten-g lden pieces, I tell you, Madame,
that zero may not turn up until nightfall.
subQuotationList: ['We have lost 144 ten-g lden pieces,', 'I tell you, Madame,\nthat zero may not turn up until nightfall.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
Never mind, Keep on staking upon zero, and also
stake a thousand g lden upon rouge. Here is a banknote with which to do
so.
subQuotationList: ['Never mind,', 'Keep on staking upon zero, and also\nstake a thousand g lden upon rouge. Here is a banknote with which to do\nso.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
But you see, you see, We have now recovered
almost all that we staked. Try zero again. Let us do so another ten
times, and then leave off.
subQuotationList: ['But you see, you see,', 'We have now recovered\nalmost all that we staked. Try zero again. Let us do so another ten\ntimes, and then leave off.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
To the devil with that zero! Stake four thousand
g lden upon the red.
subQuotationList: ['To the devil with that zero!', 'Stake four thousand\ng lden upon the red.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: But, Madame, that will be so much to venture! Suppose the red should not turn up?
subQuotationList: ['But, Madame, that will be so much to venture!', 'Suppose the red should not turn up?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Zero!
subQuotationList: ['Zero!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText: To think that that accursed zero should have turned up _now!_
subQuotationList: ['To think that that accursed zero should have turned up _now!_']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
The accursed, accursed thing! And, it is all _your_ fault, It was _you_ who persuaded me
to cease staking upon it.
subQuotationList: ['The accursed, accursed thing! And, it is all _your_ fault,', 'It was _you_ who persuaded me\nto cease staking upon it.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
But, Madame, I only explained the game to you. How am _I_ to answer
for every mischance which may occur in it?
subQuotationList: ['But, Madame, I only explained the game to you. How am _I_ to answer\nfor every mischance which may occur in it?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You and your mischances! Go! Away at
once!
subQuotationList: ['You and your mischances!', 'Go! Away at\nonce!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Farewell, then, Madame.
subQuotationList: ['Farewell, then, Madame.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
No stay, Where are you going to? Why should you
leave me? You fool! No, no... stay here. It is _I_ who was the fool.
Tell me what I ought to do.
subQuotationList: ['No stay,', 'Where are you going to? Why should you\nleave me? You fool! No, no... stay here. It is _I_ who was the fool.\nTell me what I ought to do.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
I cannot take it upon myself to advise you, for you will only blame me
if I do so. Play at your own discretion. Say exactly what you wish
staked, and I will stake it.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot take it upon myself to advise you, for you will only blame me\nif I do so. Play at your own discretion. Say exactly what you wish\nstaked, and I will stake it.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
Very well. Stake another four thousand g lden upon the red. Take this
banknote to do it with. I have still got twenty thousand roubles in
actual cash.
subQuotationList: ['Very well. Stake another four thousand g lden upon the red. Take this\nbanknote to do it with. I have still got twenty thousand roubles in\nactual cash.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: But, such a quantity of money
subQuotationList: ['But,', 'such a quantity of money']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Never mind. I cannot rest until I have won back my losses. Stake!
subQuotationList: ['Never mind. I cannot rest until I have won back my losses. Stake!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Stake again, stake again eight thousand at a stroke!
subQuotationList: ['Stake again, stake again eight thousand at a stroke!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: I cannot, Madame. The largest stake allowed is four thousand g lden.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot, Madame. The largest stake allowed is four thousand g lden.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Well, then; stake four thousand.
subQuotationList: ['Well, then; stake four thousand.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
You see, you see! Stake another four
thousand.
subQuotationList: ['You see, you see!', 'Stake another four\nthousand.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Madame, your twelve
thousand g lden are now gone,
subQuotationList: ['Madame, your twelve\nthousand g lden are now gone,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: I see they are,
subQuotationList: ['I see they are,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
I see they are, Ah well, I do not mean to
rest until I have staked another four thousand.
subQuotationList: ['I see they are,', 'Ah well, I do not mean to\nrest until I have staked another four thousand.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
But you have no money with which to do it, Madame. In this satchel I
can see only a few five percent bonds and some transfers no actual
cash.
subQuotationList: ['But you have no money with which to do it, Madame. In this satchel I\ncan see only a few five percent bonds and some transfers no actual\ncash.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: And in the purse?
subQuotationList: ['And in the purse?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: A mere trifle.
subQuotationList: ['A mere trifle.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
But there is a money-changer s office here, is there not? They told me
I should be able to get any sort of paper security changed!
subQuotationList: ['But there is a money-changer s office here, is there not? They told me\nI should be able to get any sort of paper security changed!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Quite so; to any amount you please. But you will lose on the
transaction what would frighten even a Jew.
subQuotationList: ['Quite so; to any amount you please. But you will lose on the\ntransaction what would frighten even a Jew.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Rubbish! I am _determined_ to retrieve my losses. Take me away, and
call those fools of bearers.
subQuotationList: ['Rubbish! I am _determined_ to retrieve my losses. Take me away, and\ncall those fools of bearers.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Hurry, hurry! Show me the nearest way to
the money-changer s. Is it far?
subQuotationList: ['Hurry, hurry!', 'Show me the nearest way to\nthe money-changer s. Is it far?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: A couple of steps, Madame.
subQuotationList: ['A couple of steps, Madame.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Well, well, well! But we have no time to
stop. What do you want? I can t talk to you here.
subQuotationList: ['Well, well, well!', 'But we have no time to\nstop. What do you want? I can t talk to you here.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
She has lost this morning s winnings, and also twelve
thousand g lden of her original money. At the present moment we are
going to get some bonds changed.
subQuotationList: ['She has lost this morning s winnings,', 'and also twelve\nthousand g lden of her original money. At the present moment we are\ngoing to get some bonds changed.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: Stop her, stop her,
subQuotationList: ['Stop her, stop her,']
speaker: The General

quoteText: You had better try and stop her yourself,
subQuotationList: ['You had better try and stop her yourself,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
My good mother, my good mother, pray
let, let let us hire
a carriage, and go for a drive. Near here there is an enchanting view
to be obtained. We-we-we were just coming to invite you to go and see
it.
subQuotationList:
['My good mother,', 'my good mother, pray
let, let', 'let us hire
a carriage, and go for a drive. Near here there is an enchanting view
to be obtained. We-we-we were just coming to invite you to go and see
it.']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['The General'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Begone with you and your views!
subQuotationList: ['Begone with you and your views!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: And there are trees there, and we could have tea under them,
subQuotationList: ['And there are trees there, and we could have tea under them,']
speaker: The General
addressees: ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']

quoteText: Nous boirons du lait, sur l herbe fraiche,
subQuotationList: ['Nous boirons du lait, sur l herbe fraiche,']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
Have done with you and your milk! Go and stuff
_yourself_ as much as you like, but my stomach simply recoils from the
idea. What are you stopping for? I have nothing to say to you.
subQuotationList: ['Have done with you and your milk!', 'Go and stuff\n_yourself_ as much as you like, but my stomach simply recoils from the\nidea. What are you stopping for? I have nothing to say to you.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Here we are, Madame, Here is the moneychanger s
office.
subQuotationList: ['Here we are, Madame,', 'Here is the moneychanger s\noffice.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
addressees: ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']

quoteText: The thieves!
subQuotationList: ['The thieves!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Never
mind, though. Get the documents cashed No; send the banker out to me,
subQuotationList: ['Never\nmind, though. Get the documents cashed No; send the banker out to me,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Would one of the clerks do, Madame?
subQuotationList: ['Would one of the clerks do, Madame?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Yes, one of the clerks. The thieves!
subQuotationList: ['Yes, one of the clerks. The thieves!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Pray recollect yourself! And may my money choke
you! Alexis Ivanovitch, tell him that we can easily repair to someone
else.
subQuotationList: ['Pray recollect yourself!', 'And may my money choke\nyou! Alexis Ivanovitch, tell him that we can easily repair to someone\nelse.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: The clerk says that others will give you even less than he.
subQuotationList: ['The clerk says that others will give you even less than he.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Well, well, I am no accountant. Let us hurry away, hurry
away.
subQuotationList: ['Well, well,', 'I am no accountant. Let us hurry away, hurry\naway.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Neither upon that accursed zero, however, nor upon that equally
accursed red do I mean to stake a cent,
subQuotationList: ['Neither upon that accursed zero, however, nor upon that equally\naccursed red do I mean to stake a cent,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
There you are! See what we have won!
Surely it would be worth our while to stake four thousand instead of a
hundred, for we might win another four thousand, and then ! Oh, it was
YOUR fault before all your fault!
subQuotationList:
['There you are!', 'See what we have won!
Surely it would be worth our while to stake four thousand instead of a
hundred, for we might win another four thousand, and then ! Oh, it was
YOUR fault before all your fault!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: Madame, Madame,
subQuotationList: ['Madame, Madame,']
speaker: Marqis De Griers
referringExpression: sounded the honeyed accents of De Griers

quoteText:
That stake will never win.
No, no, it is impossible, No, no!
subQuotationList: ['That stake will never win.\nNo, no, it is impossible,', 'No, no!']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
But why not? Show me what I
ought to do.
subQuotationList: ['But why not?', 'Show me what I\nought to do.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Away with you! You talk sheer nonsense, for, though
you keep on saying you haven t the least notion what
ought to be done. Away with you, I say!
subQuotationList: ['Away with you!', 'You talk sheer nonsense, for, though\nyou keep on saying', 'you haven t the least notion what\nought to be done. Away with you, I say!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Mais, Madame,
subQuotationList: ['Mais, Madame,']
speaker: Marqis De Griers

quoteText:
Stake just _once_, as he advises, and
then we shall see what we _shall_ see. Of course, his stake _might_
win.
subQuotationList: ['Stake just _once_, as he advises,', 'and\nthen we shall see what we _shall_ see. Of course, his stake _might_\nwin.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: Zero!
subQuotationList: ['Zero!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText:
The fool! You
infernal Frenchman, to think that _you_ should advise! Away with you!
Though you fuss and fuss, you don t even know what you re talking
about.
subQuotationList:
['The fool!', 'You
infernal Frenchman, to think that _you_ should advise! Away with you!
Though you fuss and fuss, you don t even know what you re talking
about.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Home!
subQuotationList: ['Home!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
What a fool I am! What a silly old fool I am, to be
sure!
subQuotationList: ['What a fool I am! What a silly old fool I am, to be\nsure!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: We are off again,
subQuotationList: ['We are off again,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: But whither, Madame?
subQuotationList: ['But whither, Madame?']
speaker: Martha

quoteText:
What business is that of _yours?_ Let the cricket stick to its
hearth.
subQuotationList: ['What business is that of _yours?_ Let the cricket stick to its\nhearth.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Potapitch, have everything packed, for we are returning to
Moscow at once. I have fooled away fifteen thousand roubles.
subQuotationList: ['Potapitch, have everything packed, for we are returning to\nMoscow at once. I have fooled away fifteen thousand roubles.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Fifteen thousand roubles, good mistress? My God!
subQuotationList: ['Fifteen thousand roubles, good mistress? My God!']
speaker: Potapitch

quoteText:
Now then, you fool! At once you begin with your weeping and wailing!
Be quiet, and pack. Also, run downstairs, and get my hotel bill.
subQuotationList: ['Now then, you fool! At once you begin with your weeping and wailing!\nBe quiet, and pack. Also, run downstairs, and get my hotel bill.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: The next train leaves at 9:30, Madame,
subQuotationList: ['The next train leaves at 9:30, Madame,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: And what is the time now?
subQuotationList: ['And what is the time now?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Half-past eight.
subQuotationList: ['Half-past eight.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
How vexing! But, never mind. Alexis Ivanovitch, I have not a kopeck
left; I have but these two bank notes. Please run to the office and get
them changed. Otherwise I shall have nothing to travel with.
subQuotationList: ['How vexing! But, never mind. Alexis Ivanovitch, I have not a kopeck\nleft; I have but these two bank notes. Please run to the office and get\nthem changed. Otherwise I shall have nothing to travel with.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Away with you, you rascals! What have my affairs
to do with you? Why, in particular, do _you_ come sneaking here with your goat s beard? And what do
_you_ want of me? What are _you_
finicking for?
subQuotationList:
['Away with you, you rascals!', 'What have my affairs
to do with you? Why, in particular, do _you_', 'come sneaking here with your goat s beard? And what do
_you_', 'want of me? What are _you_
finicking for?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers']], [['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Mlle. Blanche']], [['Mlle. Blanche']]]

quoteText: Diantre!
subQuotationList: ['Diantre!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']

quoteText: Elle vivra cent ans!
subQuotationList: ['Elle vivra cent ans!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
addressees: ['The General', 'Marqis De Griers', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Alexis Ivanovitch', 'Potapitch', 'Martha']
referringExpression: she burst into a laugh and left the room crying to the General

quoteText:
So you have been counting upon my death, have you? Away with you! Clear them out of the room, Alexis Ivanovitch.
What business is it of _theirs?_ It is not _their_ money that I have
been squandering, but my own.
subQuotationList: ['So you have been counting upon my death, have you?', 'Away with you! Clear them out of the room, Alexis Ivanovitch.\nWhat business is it of _theirs?_ It is not _their_ money that I have\nbeen squandering, but my own.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: Call Prascovia,
subQuotationList: ['Call Prascovia,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Prascovia, is what I have just heard through
a side wind true namely, that this fool of a stepfather of yours is
going to marry that silly whirligig of a Frenchwoman that actress, or
something worse? Tell me, is it true?
subQuotationList:
['Prascovia,', 'is what I have just heard through
a side wind true namely, that this fool of a stepfather of yours is
going to marry that silly whirligig of a Frenchwoman that actress, or
something worse? Tell me, is it true?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionTextsList: [['Prascovia'], ['this fool of a stepfather of yours', 'that actress']]

quoteText:
I do not know _for certain_, Grandmamma, but from
Mlle. Blanche s account (for she does not appear to think it necessary
to conceal anything) I conclude that
subQuotationList: ['I do not know _for certain_, Grandmamma,', 'but from\nMlle. Blanche s account (for she does not appear to think it necessary\nto conceal anything) I conclude that']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: You need not say any more,
subQuotationList: ['You need not say any more,']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
I understand the situation. I always thought we should get something
like this from him, for I always looked upon him as a futile, frivolous
fellow who gave himself unconscionable airs on the fact of his being a
general (though he only became one because he retired as a colonel).
Yes, I know _all_ about the sending of the telegrams to inquire whether
 the old woman is likely to turn up her toes soon.  Ah, they were
looking for the legacies! Without money that wretched woman (what is
her name? Oh, De Cominges) would never dream of accepting the General
and his false teeth no, not even for him to be her lacquey since she
herself, they say, possesses a pile of money, and lends it on interest,
and makes a good thing out of it. However, it is not _you_, Prascovia,
that I am blaming; it was not _you_ who sent those telegrams. Nor, for
that matter, do I wish to recall old scores. True, I know that you are
a vixen by nature that you are a wasp which will sting one if one
touches it yet, my heart is sore for you, for I loved your mother,
Katerina. Now, will you leave everything here, and come away with me?
Otherwise, I do not know what is to become of you, and it is not right
that you should continue living with these people. Nay, I have not yet
finished. I ask of you nothing in return. My house in Moscow is, as you
know, large enough for a palace, and you could occupy a whole floor of
it if you liked, and keep away from me for weeks together. Will you
come with me or will you not?
subQuotationList:
['I understand the situation. I always thought we should get something
like this from him, for I always looked upon him as a futile, frivolous
fellow who gave himself unconscionable airs on the fact of his being a
general (though he only became one because he retired as a colonel).
Yes, I know _all_ about the sending of the telegrams to inquire whether
 the old woman is likely to turn up her toes soon.  Ah, they were
looking for the legacies! Without money that wretched woman (what is

and his false teeth no, not even for him to be her lacquey since she
herself, they say, possesses a pile of money, and lends it on interest,
and makes a good thing out of it. However, it is not _you_, Prascovia,
that I am blaming; it was not _you_ who sent those telegrams. Nor, for
that matter, do I wish to recall old scores. True, I know that you are
a vixen by nature that you are a wasp which will sting one if one
touches it yet, my heart is sore for you, for I loved your mother,
Katerina. Now, will you leave everything here, and come away with me?
Otherwise, I do not know what is to become of you, and it is not right
that you should continue living with these people. Nay,', 'I have not yet
finished. I ask of you nothing in return. My house in Moscow is, as you
know, large enough for a palace, and you could occupy a whole floor of
it if you liked, and keep away from me for weeks together. Will you
come with me or will you not?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']], [['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
First of all, let me ask of _you_, whether you are
intending to depart at once?
subQuotationList: ['First of all, let me ask of _you_,', 'whether you are\nintending to depart at once?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
What? You suppose me to be jesting? I have said that I am going, and I
_am_ going. Today I have squandered fifteen thousand roubles at that
accursed roulette of yours, and though, five years ago, I promised the
people of a certain suburb of Moscow to build them a stone church in
place of a wooden one, I have been fooling away my money here! However,
I am going back now to build my church.
subQuotationList:
['What? You suppose me to be jesting? I have said that I am going, and I
_am_ going. Today I have squandered fifteen thousand roubles at that
accursed roulette of yours, and though, five years ago, I promised the
people of a certain suburb of Moscow to build them a stone church in
place of a wooden one, I have been fooling away my money here! However,
I am going back now to build my church.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
But what about the waters, Grandmamma? Surely you came here to take
the waters?
subQuotationList: ['But what about the waters, Grandmamma? Surely you came here to take\nthe waters?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
You and your waters! Do not anger me, Prascovia. Surely you are trying
to? Say, then: will you, or will you not, come with me?
subQuotationList: ['You and your waters! Do not anger me, Prascovia. Surely you are trying\nto? Say, then: will you, or will you not, come with me?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
Grandmamma, I am very, very
grateful to you for the shelter which you have so kindly offered me.
Also, to a certain extent you have guessed my position aright, and I am
beholden to you to such an extent that it may be that I _will_ come and
live with you, and that very soon; yet there are important reasons
why why I cannot make up my mind just yet. If you would let me have,
say, a couple of weeks to decide in ?
subQuotationList:
['Grandmamma,', 'I am very, very
grateful to you for the shelter which you have so kindly offered me.
Also, to a certain extent you have guessed my position aright, and I am
beholden to you to such an extent that it may be that I _will_ come and
live with you, and that very soon; yet there are important reasons
why why I cannot make up my mind just yet. If you would let me have,
say, a couple of weeks to decide in ?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: You mean that you are _not_ coming?
subQuotationList: ['You mean that you are _not_ coming?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
I mean only that I cannot come just yet. At all events, I could not
well leave my little brother and sister here, since, since if I were to
leave them they would be abandoned altogether. But if, Grandmamma, you
would take the little ones _and_ myself, then, of course, I could come
with you, and would do all I could to serve you
subQuotationList:
['I mean only that I cannot come just yet. At all events, I could not
well leave my little brother and sister here, since, since if I were to
leave them they would be abandoned altogether. But if, Grandmamma, you
would take the little ones _and_ myself, then, of course, I could come
with you, and would do all I could to serve you']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Only, without the little ones I _cannot_ come.
subQuotationList: ['Only, without the little ones I _cannot_ come.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Do not make a fuss
subQuotationList: ['Do not make a fuss']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: The Great Foster-Father
subQuotationList: ['The Great Foster-Father']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
can find for all
his chicks a place. You are not coming without the children? But see
here, Prascovia. I wish you well, and nothing but well: yet I have
divined the reason why you will not come. Yes, I know all, Prascovia.
That Frenchman will never bring you good of any sort.
subQuotationList:
['can find for all
his chicks a place. You are not coming without the children? But see
here, Prascovia. I wish you well, and nothing but well: yet I have
divined the reason why you will not come. Yes, I know all, Prascovia.
That Frenchman will never bring you good of any sort.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
For, every one seems to know about that affair. Or perhaps I am the only
one who does not know about it?
subQuotationList: ['For,', 'every one seems to know about that affair. Or perhaps I am the only\none who does not know about it?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Now, now! Do not frown, But I do not
intend to slur things over. You will take care that no harm befalls
you, will you not? For you are a girl of sense, and I am sorry for
you I regard you in a different light to the rest of them. And now,
please, leave me. Good-bye.
subQuotationList:
['Now, now! Do not frown,', 'But I do not
intend to slur things over. You will take care that no harm befalls
you, will you not? For you are a girl of sense, and I am sorry for
you I regard you in a different light to the rest of them. And now,
please, leave me. Good-bye.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: But let me stay with you a little longer,
subQuotationList: ['But let me stay with you a little longer,']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
No, you need not. Do not bother me, for you and
all of them have tired me out.
subQuotationList: ['No,', 'you need not. Do not bother me, for you and\nall of them have tired me out.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['The General', 'Mlle. Blanche', 'Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
And good-bye to you, also, Alexis Ivanovitch. The train starts in an
hour s time, and I think that you must be weary of me. Take these five
hundred g lden for yourself.
subQuotationList: ['And good-bye to you, also, Alexis Ivanovitch. The train starts in an\nhour s time, and I think that you must be weary of me. Take these five\nhundred g lden for yourself.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: I thank you humbly, Madame, but I am ashamed to
subQuotationList: ['I thank you humbly, Madame, but I am ashamed to']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Come, come!
subQuotationList: ['Come, come!']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
If, when in Moscow, you have no place where you can lay your head, come and see me, and I will give you a recommendation. Now,
Potapitch, get things ready.
subQuotationList: ['If, when in Moscow, you have no place where you can lay your head,', 'come and see me, and I will give you a recommendation. Now,\nPotapitch, get things ready.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: Sir, my mistress is asking for you.
subQuotationList: ['Sir,', 'my mistress is asking for you.']
speaker: Potapitch

quoteText:
Indeed? But she is just departing, is she not? The train leaves in ten
minutes  time.
subQuotationList: ['Indeed? But she is just departing, is she not? The train leaves in ten\nminutes  time.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: She is uneasy, sir; she cannot rest. Come quickly, sir; do not delay.
subQuotationList: ['She is uneasy, sir; she cannot rest. Come quickly, sir; do not delay.']
speaker: Potapitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Alexis Ivanovitch, walk on ahead, and we will set out
again.
subQuotationList: ['Alexis Ivanovitch,', 'walk on ahead, and we will set out\nagain.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: But whither, Madame?
subQuotationList: ['But whither, Madame?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
I cannot rest until I have retrieved my losses. March on ahead, and
ask me no questions. Play continues until midnight, does it not?
subQuotationList: ['I cannot rest until I have retrieved my losses. March on ahead, and\nask me no questions. Play continues until midnight, does it not?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText: With your leave, Madame, I will not go with you.
subQuotationList: ['With your leave, Madame,', 'I will not go with you.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
And why not? What do you mean? Is every one here a stupid
good-for-nothing?
subQuotationList: ['And why not? What do you mean? Is every one here a stupid\ngood-for-nothing?']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
Pardon me, but I have nothing to reproach myself with. I merely will
not go. I merely intend neither to witness nor to join in your play. I
also beg to return you your five hundred g lden. Farewell.
subQuotationList: ['Pardon me, but I have nothing to reproach myself with. I merely will\nnot go. I merely intend neither to witness nor to join in your play. I\nalso beg to return you your five hundred g lden. Farewell.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
What folly! Very well, then. Do
not come, and I will find my way alone. Potapitch, you must come with
me. Lift up the chair, and carry me along.
subQuotationList: ['What folly!', 'Very well, then. Do\nnot come, and I will find my way alone. Potapitch, you must come with\nme. Lift up the chair, and carry me along.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
_You_, treated her as a gentleman should, but he he
robbed her right and left, as I could see with my own eyes. Twice she
caught him at it, and rated him soundly. On one occasion she even
pulled his hair, so that the bystanders burst out laughing. Yet she
lost everything, sir that is to say, she lost all that you had changed
for her. Then we brought her home, and, after asking for some water and
saying her prayers, she went to bed. So worn out was she that she fell
asleep at once. May God send her dreams of angels! And _this_ is all
that foreign travel has done for us! Oh, my own Moscow! For what have
we not at home there, in Moscow? Such a garden and flowers as you could
never see here, and fresh air and apple-trees coming into blossom, and
a beautiful view to look upon. Ah, but what must she do but go
travelling abroad? Alack, alack!
subQuotationList:
['_You_,', 'treated her as a gentleman should, but he he
robbed her right and left, as I could see with my own eyes. Twice she
caught him at it, and rated him soundly. On one occasion she even

for her. Then we brought her home, and, after asking for some water and

never see here, and fresh air and apple-trees coming into blossom, and
a beautiful view to look upon. Ah, but what must she do but go
travelling abroad? Alack, alack!']
speaker: Potapitch
referringExpression: the old chamberlain said to me

quoteText: Ah!
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: She is gambling away everything that she has,
subQuotationList: ['She is gambling away everything that she has,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Indeed? She arrived at the Casino even before I had taken my departure
by train, so I knew she had been playing. If I should have time I will
go to the Casino to-night, and take a look at her. The thing interests
me.
subQuotationList:
['Indeed? She arrived at the Casino even before I had taken my departure
by train, so I knew she had been playing. If I should have time I will
go to the Casino to-night, and take a look at her. The thing interests
me.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: Where have you been today?
subQuotationList: ['Where have you been today?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: To Frankfort.
subQuotationList: ['To Frankfort.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: On business?
subQuotationList: ['On business?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: On business.
subQuotationList: ['On business.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: the compliments of a certain person.
subQuotationList: ['the compliments of a certain person.']
speaker: The Lacquey

quoteText: Oh, Alexis Ivanovitch! Save me, save me! Have some mercy upon me!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, Alexis Ivanovitch! Save me, save me! Have some mercy upon me!']
speaker: The General

quoteText:
Have mercy,
mercy!
subQuotationList: ['Have mercy,\nmercy!']
speaker: The General
referringExpression: he kept talking and talking and constantly repeating

quoteText:
But, General, possibly Mlle. Blanche has scarcely even
remarked my existence? What could _I_ do with her?
subQuotationList: ['But, General,', 'possibly Mlle. Blanche has scarcely even\nremarked my existence? What could _I_ do with her?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
In Russia, or in
any well-ordered State where there exists a government, old women like
my mother are placed under proper guardianship. Yes, my good sir, do you not know this do you not know
this, that in Russia old women like her are subjected to restraint, the
devil take them?
subQuotationList:
['In Russia,', 'or in
any well-ordered State where there exists a government, old women like
my mother are placed under proper guardianship. Yes, my good sir,', 'do you not know this', 'do you not know
this, that in Russia old women like her are subjected to restraint, the
devil take them?']
speaker: The General
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
He has gone away, and everything which I possess
is mortgaged to him. I stand stripped to my skin. Even of the money
which you brought me from Paris, I know not if seven hundred francs be
left. Of course that sum will do to go on with, but, as regards the
future, I know nothing, I know nothing.
subQuotationList:
['He has gone away,', 'and everything which I possess
is mortgaged to him. I stand stripped to my skin. Even of the money
which you brought me from Paris, I know not if seven hundred francs be
left. Of course that sum will do to go on with, but, as regards the
future, I know nothing, I know nothing.']
speaker: The General

quoteText:
Then how will you pay your hotel bill? And
what shall you do afterwards?
subQuotationList: ['Then how will you pay your hotel bill?', 'And\nwhat shall you do afterwards?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Yes, yes,
subQuotationList: ['Yes, yes,']
speaker: The General

quoteText:
What on earth
am I to do? What on earth am I to do? Is this not
ingratitude? Is it not sheer ingratitude?
subQuotationList: ['What on earth\nam I to do?', 'What on earth am I to do? Is this not\ningratitude? Is it not sheer ingratitude?']
speaker: The General

quoteText:
Good evening, Alexis Ivanovitch, Pardon me for disturbing you again. Yes, you must pardon an
old, old woman like myself, for I have left behind me all that I
possess nearly a hundred thousand roubles! You did quite right in
declining to come with me this evening. Now I am without money without
a single groat. But I must not delay a moment; I must leave by the 9:30
train. I have sent for that English friend of yours, and am going to
beg of him three thousand francs for a week. Please try and persuade
him to think nothing of it, nor yet to refuse me, for I am still a rich
woman who possesses three villages and a couple of mansions. Yes, the
money shall be found, for I have not yet squandered _everything_. I
tell you this in order that he may have no doubts about Ah, but here he
is! Clearly he is a good fellow.
subQuotationList:
['Good evening, Alexis Ivanovitch,', 'Pardon me for disturbing you again. Yes, you must pardon an
old, old woman like myself, for I have left behind me all that I
possess nearly a hundred thousand roubles! You did quite right in
declining to come with me this evening. Now I am without money without
a single groat. But I must not delay a moment; I must leave by the 9:30
train. I have sent for that English friend of yours, and am going to
beg of him three thousand francs for a week. Please try and persuade
him to think nothing of it, nor yet to refuse me, for I am still a rich
woman who possesses three villages and a couple of mansions. Yes, the
money shall be found, for I have not yet squandered _everything_. I
tell you this in order that he may have no doubts about Ah, but here he
is! Clearly he is a good fellow.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
You too leave me, Alexis Ivanovitch, All my
bones are aching, and I still have an hour in which to rest. Do not be
hard upon me, old fool that I am. Never again shall I blame young
people for being frivolous. I should think it wrong even to blame that
unhappy General of yours. Nevertheless, I do not mean to let him have
any of my money (which is all that he desires), for the reason that I
look upon him as a perfect blockhead, and consider myself, simpleton
though I be, at least wiser than _he_ is. How surely does God visit old
age, and punish it for its presumption! Well, good-bye. Martha, come
and lift me up.
subQuotationList:
['You too leave me, Alexis Ivanovitch,', 'All my
bones are aching, and I still have an hour in which to rest. Do not be
hard upon me, old fool that I am. Never again shall I blame young
people for being frivolous. I should think it wrong even to blame that
unhappy General of yours. Nevertheless, I do not mean to let him have
any of my money (which is all that he desires), for the reason that I
look upon him as a perfect blockhead, and consider myself, simpleton
though I be, at least wiser than _he_ is. How surely does God visit old
age, and punish it for its presumption! Well, good-bye. Martha, come
and lift me up.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Martha']]]

quoteText:
Thanks for your disinterested assistance, Oh,
and please remind Prascovia of what I said to her last night. I expect
soon to see her.
subQuotationList: ['Thanks for your disinterested assistance,', 'Oh,\nand please remind Prascovia of what I said to her last night. I expect\nsoon to see her.']
speaker: Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha

quoteText:
There is nothing
new to report, sir,
subQuotationList: ['There is nothing\nnew to report, sir,']
speaker: The Nursemaid

quoteText: What is the matter? What is the matter?
subQuotationList: ['What is the matter? What is the matter?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Why, the fact that you are _here!_
subQuotationList: ['Why, the fact that you are _here!_']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
If I am here, I have come with all that I have to bring, Such has always been my way, as you shall presently see. Please light
a candle.
subQuotationList: ['If I am here, I have come with all that I have to bring,', 'Such has always been my way, as you shall presently see. Please light\na candle.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Read it,
subQuotationList: ['Read it,']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: It is De Griers  handwriting!
subQuotationList: ['It is De Griers  handwriting!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
All this is clear enough, Surely you did not expect
aught else from him?
subQuotationList: ['All this is clear enough,', 'Surely you did not expect\naught else from him?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
I expected nothing at all from him, Long
ago I made up my mind on the subject, for I could read his thoughts,
and knew what he was thinking. He thought that possibly I should sue
him that one day I might become a nuisance. So of set purpose I redoubled my
contemptuous treatment of him, and waited to see what he would do. If a
telegram to say that we had become legatees had arrived from, St.
Petersburg, I should have flung at him a quittance for my foolish
stepfather s debts, and then dismissed him. For a long time I have
hated him. Even in earlier days he was not a man; and now! Oh, how
gladly I could throw those fifty thousand roubles in his face, and spit
in it, and then rub the spittle in!
subQuotationList:
['I expected nothing at all from him,', 'Long
ago I made up my mind on the subject, for I could read his thoughts,
and knew what he was thinking. He thought that possibly I should sue
him that one day I might become a nuisance.', 'So of set purpose I redoubled my
contemptuous treatment of him, and waited to see what he would do. If a
telegram to say that we had become legatees had arrived from, St.
Petersburg, I should have flung at him a quittance for my foolish
stepfather s debts, and then dismissed him. For a long time I have
hated him. Even in earlier days he was not a man; and now! Oh, how
gladly I could throw those fifty thousand roubles in his face, and spit
in it, and then rub the spittle in!']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers', 'Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
But the document returning the fifty-thousand rouble mortgage has the
General got it? If so, possess yourself of it, and send it to De
Griers.
subQuotationList: ['But the document returning the fifty-thousand rouble mortgage has the\nGeneral got it? If so, possess yourself of it, and send it to De\nGriers.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: No, no; the General has not got it.
subQuotationList: ['No, no; the General has not got it.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Just as I expected! Well, what is the General going to do?
subQuotationList: ['Just as I expected! Well, what is the General going to do?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: What about the Grandmother?
subQuotationList: ['What about the Grandmother?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: What makes you speak of _her?_
subQuotationList: ['What makes you speak of _her?_']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
I cannot
go and live with her. Nor, will I go down upon my
knees to _any one_.
subQuotationList: ['I cannot\ngo and live with her. Nor,', 'will I go down upon my\nknees to _any one_.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
Why should you? Yet to think that you should have loved De
Griers! The villain, the villain! But I will kill him in a duel. Where
is he now?
subQuotationList: ['Why should you?', 'Yet to think that you should have loved De\nGriers! The villain, the villain! But I will kill him in a duel. Where\nis he now?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna']], [['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText: In Frankfort, where he will be staying for the next three days.
subQuotationList: ['In Frankfort, where he will be staying for the next three days.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Well, bid me do so, and I will go to him by the first train tomorrow,
subQuotationList: ['Well, bid me do so, and I will go to him by the first train tomorrow,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
If you were to do that, he would merely tell you to be so
good as first to return him the fifty thousand francs. What, then,
would be the use of having a quarrel with him? You talk sheer
nonsense.
subQuotationList:
['If you were to do that,', 'he would merely tell you to be so
good as first to return him the fifty thousand francs. What, then,
would be the use of having a quarrel with him? You talk sheer
nonsense.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
The question, is how to raise the fifty thousand francs.
We cannot expect to find them lying about on the floor. Listen. What of
Mr. Astley?
subQuotationList: ['The question,', 'is how to raise the fifty thousand francs.\nWe cannot expect to find them lying about on the floor. Listen. What of\nMr. Astley?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: What? _you yourself_ wish me to leave you for him?
subQuotationList: ['What? _you yourself_ wish me to leave you for him?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
Polina, give me but an hour. Wait here just one hour until I
return. Yes, you MUST do so. Do you not see what I mean? Just stay here
for that time.
subQuotationList: ['Polina,', 'give me but an hour. Wait here just one hour until I\nreturn. Yes, you MUST do so. Do you not see what I mean? Just stay here\nfor that time.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Vingt-deux! Trente-et-un! Rouge! Quatre!
subQuotationList: ['Vingt-deux!', 'Trente-et-un!', 'Rouge!', 'Quatre!']
speaker: The Croupier

quoteText: Go away now, go away now,
subQuotationList: ['Go away now, go away now,']
speaker: A Certain Jew Of Frankfurt

quoteText: Yes, for God s sake go,
subQuotationList: ['Yes, for God s sake go,']
speaker: A Modestly, Plainly Dressed Lady

quoteText:
You are a bold young fellow, but mind you depart early
tomorrow as early as you can for if you do not you will lose everything
that you have won.
subQuotationList: ['You are a bold young fellow,', 'but mind you depart early\ntomorrow as early as you can for if you do not you will lose everything\nthat you have won.']
speaker: One Jew
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: I have won two hundred thousand francs!
subQuotationList: ['I have won two hundred thousand francs!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Shall I put the money there until tomorrow?
subQuotationList: ['Shall I put the money there until tomorrow?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Polina, here are twenty-five thousand florins fifty thousand
francs, or more. Take them, and tomorrow throw them in De Griers 
face.
subQuotationList: ['Polina,', 'here are twenty-five thousand florins fifty thousand\nfrancs, or more. Take them, and tomorrow throw them in De Griers \nface.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Or, if you should prefer, let me take them to him
myself tomorrow yes, early tomorrow morning. Shall I?
subQuotationList: ['Or, if you should prefer,', 'let me take them to him\nmyself tomorrow yes, early tomorrow morning. Shall I?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: I am _not_ going to take your money,
subQuotationList: ['I am _not_ going to take your money,']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Why not? Why not, Polina?
subQuotationList: ['Why not?', 'Why not, Polina?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Because I am not in the habit of receiving money for nothing.
subQuotationList: ['Because I am not in the habit of receiving money for nothing.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
But I am offering it to you as a _friend_. In the same way I would
offer you my very life.
subQuotationList: ['But I am offering it to you as a _friend_. In the same way I would\noffer you my very life.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You are giving too much for me, The
beloved of De Griers is not worth fifty thousand francs.
subQuotationList: ['You are giving too much for me,', 'The\nbeloved of De Griers is not worth fifty thousand francs.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
Oh Polina, how can you speak so? Am _I_
De Griers?
subQuotationList: ['Oh Polina, how can you speak so?', 'Am _I_\nDe Griers?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You? Why, I _hate_ you!
Yes, yes, I _hate_ you! I love you no more than I do De Griers.
subQuotationList: ['You?', 'Why, I _hate_ you!\nYes, yes, I _hate_ you! I love you no more than I do De Griers.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
Buy me, would you, would you? Would you buy me for fifty thousand
francs as De Griers did?
subQuotationList: ['Buy me, would you, would you? Would you buy me for fifty thousand\nfrancs as De Griers did?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
You love me? _Do_ you? you who were willing even to
quarrel with the Baron at my bidding?
subQuotationList: ['You love me?', '_Do_ you? you who were willing even to\nquarrel with the Baron at my bidding?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: No, no! _You_ are my dear one; _you_ are the man I trust.
subQuotationList: ['No, no!', '_You_ are my dear one; _you_ are the man I trust.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: You love me, you love me? Will you _always_ love me?
subQuotationList: ['You love me, you love me? Will you _always_ love me?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Yes, yes, he is there, Open the window, and see if he is not.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, yes, he is there,', 'Open the window, and see if he is not.']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
Shall we go away tomorrow? How would it be
if we were to try and overtake Grandmamma? I think we should do so at
Berlin. And what think you she would have to say to us when we caught
her up, and her eyes first lit upon us? What, too, about Mr. Astley?
_He_ would not leap from the Shlangenberg for my sake! No! Of that I am
very sure! Do you know where he is going next year?
He says he intends to go to the North Pole for scientific
investigations, and has invited me to go with him! Ha, ha, ha! He also
says that we Russians know nothing, can do nothing, without European
help. But he is a good fellow all the same. For instance, he does not
blame the General in the matter, but declares that Mlle. Blanche that
love But no; I do not know, I do not know. What poor
creatures these people are. How sorry I am for them, and for
Grandmamma! But when are you going to kill De Griers? Surely you do not
intend actually to murder him? You fool! Do you suppose that I should
_allow_ you to fight De Griers? Nor shall you kill the Baron. How absurd you looked when you were talking to the
Burmergelms! I was watching you all the time watching you from where I
was sitting. And how unwilling you were to go when I sent you! Oh, how
I laughed and laughed!
