quoteText: Well? Are you going to hand me over my fifty thousand francs?
subQuotationList: ['Well? Are you going to hand me over my fifty thousand francs?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna
referringExpression: Polina rose from the window approached the table and looking at me with an expression of infinite aversion said

quoteText: Polina, you say that _again, again?_
subQuotationList: ['Polina, you say that _again, again?_']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You have changed your mind, then? Ha, ha, ha! You are sorry you ever
promised them?
subQuotationList: ['You have changed your mind, then? Ha, ha, ha! You are sorry you ever\npromised them?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: The francs are mine, then, are they? They are mine?
subQuotationList: ['The francs are mine, then, are they? They are mine?']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText: Yes; they have _always_ been yours,
subQuotationList: ['Yes; they have _always_ been yours,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Then _take_ your fifty thousand francs!
subQuotationList: ['Then _take_ your fifty thousand francs!']
speaker: Polina Alexandrovna

quoteText:
Mlle. left me but ten minutes ago, What can have become of
her?
subQuotationList: ['Mlle. left me but ten minutes ago,', 'What can have become of\nher?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Oh, these Russians!
subQuotationList: ['Oh, these Russians!']
speaker: The Landlord

quoteText: She is ill,
subQuotationList: ['She is ill,']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: And she is in your rooms.
subQuotationList: ['And she is in your rooms.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Yes, she is in my rooms.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, she is in my rooms.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Then you are minded to keep her there?
subQuotationList: ['Then you are minded to keep her there?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Yes, I am minded to keep her there.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I am minded to keep her there.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
But, Mr. Astley, that will raise a scandal. It ought not to be
allowed. Besides, she is very ill. Perhaps you had not remarked that?
subQuotationList: ['But, Mr. Astley, that will raise a scandal. It ought not to be\nallowed. Besides, she is very ill. Perhaps you had not remarked that?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Yes, I have. It was I who told you about it. Had she not been ill, she
would not have gone and spent the night with you.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I have. It was I who told you about it. Had she not been ill, she\nwould not have gone and spent the night with you.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Then you know all about it?
subQuotationList: ['Then you know all about it?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Yes; for last night she was to have accompanied me to the house of a
relative of mine. Unfortunately, being ill, she made a mistake, and
went to your rooms instead.
subQuotationList: ['Yes; for last night she was to have accompanied me to the house of a\nrelative of mine. Unfortunately, being ill, she made a mistake, and\nwent to your rooms instead.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Indeed? Then I wish you joy, Mr. Astley. Apropos, you have reminded me
of something. Were you beneath my window last night? Every moment Mlle.
Polina kept telling me to open the window and see if you were there;
after which she always smiled.
subQuotationList:
['Indeed? Then I wish you joy, Mr. Astley. Apropos, you have reminded me
of something. Were you beneath my window last night? Every moment Mlle.
Polina kept telling me to open the window and see if you were there;
after which she always smiled.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
Indeed? No, I was not there; but I was waiting in the corridor, and
walking about the hotel.
subQuotationList: ['Indeed? No, I was not there; but I was waiting in the corridor, and\nwalking about the hotel.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: She ought to see a doctor, you know, Mr. Astley.
subQuotationList: ['She ought to see a doctor, you know, Mr. Astley.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Yes, she ought. I have sent for one, and, if she dies, I shall hold
you responsible.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, she ought. I have sent for one, and, if she dies, I shall hold\nyou responsible.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Pardon me, but what do you mean?
subQuotationList: ['Pardon me,', 'but what do you mean?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Never mind. Tell me if it is true that, last night, you won two
hundred thousand thalers?
subQuotationList: ['Never mind. Tell me if it is true that, last night, you won two\nhundred thousand thalers?']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: No; I won a hundred thousand florins.
subQuotationList: ['No; I won a hundred thousand florins.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Good heavens! Then I suppose you will be off to Paris this morning?
subQuotationList: ['Good heavens! Then I suppose you will be off to Paris this morning?']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Why?
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Because all Russians who have grown rich go to Paris,
subQuotationList: ['Because all Russians who have grown rich go to Paris,']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
But what could I do in Paris in summer time? I _love_ her, Mr. Astley!
Surely you know that?
subQuotationList: ['But what could I do in Paris in summer time? I _love_ her, Mr. Astley!\nSurely you know that?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Indeed? I am sure that you do _not_. Moreover, if you were to stay
here, you would lose everything that you possess, and have nothing left
with which to pay your expenses in Paris. Well, good-bye now. I feel
sure that today will see you gone from here.
subQuotationList:
['Indeed? I am sure that you do _not_. Moreover, if you were to stay
here, you would lose everything that you possess, and have nothing left
with which to pay your expenses in Paris. Well, good-bye now. I feel
sure that today will see you gone from here.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Good-bye. But I am _not_ going to Paris. Likewise pardon me what is to
become of this family? I mean that the affair of the General and Mlle.
Polina will soon be all over the town.
subQuotationList: ['Good-bye. But I am _not_ going to Paris. Likewise pardon me what is to\nbecome of this family? I mean that the affair of the General and Mlle.\nPolina will soon be all over the town.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna', 'The General', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText:
I daresay; yet, I hardly suppose that that will break the General s
heart. Moreover, Mlle. Polina has a perfect right to live where she
chooses. In short, we may say that, as a family, this family has ceased
to exist.
subQuotationList:
['I daresay; yet, I hardly suppose that that will break the General s
heart. Moreover, Mlle. Polina has a perfect right to live where she
chooses. In short, we may say that, as a family, this family has ceased
to exist.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Mr. Astley', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna', 'The General', 'Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText:
I suppose he means
to shoot me in a duel, should Polina die. Yes, that is what he intends
to do.
subQuotationList: ['I suppose he means\nto shoot me in a duel, should Polina die. Yes, that is what he intends\nto do.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Ah, c est lui! Viens, donc, b te! Is it true that you have won a
mountain of gold and silver? J aimerais mieux l or.
subQuotationList: ['Ah, c est lui! Viens, donc, b te! Is it true that you have won a\nmountain of gold and silver? J aimerais mieux l or.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: Yes,
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: How much?
subQuotationList: ['How much?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: A hundred thousand florins.
subQuotationList: ['A hundred thousand florins.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Bibi, comme tu es b te! Come in here, for I can t hear you where you
are now. Nous ferons bombance, n est-ce pas?
subQuotationList: ['Bibi, comme tu es b te! Come in here, for I can t hear you where you\nare now. Nous ferons bombance, n est-ce pas?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: Mon fils, as-tu du c ur?
subQuotationList: ['Mon fils, as-tu du c ur?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: Tout autre
subQuotationList: ['Tout autre']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
See here, Please search for my stockings, and help
me to dress. Aussi, si tu n es pas trop b te je te prends   Paris. I am
just off, let me tell you.
subQuotationList: ['See here,', 'Please search for my stockings, and help\nme to dress. Aussi, si tu n es pas trop b te je te prends   Paris. I am\njust off, let me tell you.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: This moment?
subQuotationList: ['This moment?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: In half an hour.
subQuotationList: ['In half an hour.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Eh bien, tu verras Paris. Dis donc, qu est-ce que c est qu un
 utchitel ? Tu  tais bien b te quand tu  tais  utchitel.  Where are my
stockings? Please help me to dress.
subQuotationList: ['Eh bien, tu verras Paris. Dis donc, qu est-ce que c est qu un\n utchitel ? Tu  tais bien b te quand tu  tais  utchitel.  Where are my\nstockings? Please help me to dress.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Eh bien, que feras-tu si je te prends avec moi? First of all I must
have fifty thousand francs, and you shall give them to me at Frankfurt.
Then we will go on to Paris, where we will live together, et je te
ferai voir des  toiles en plein jour. Yes, you shall see such women as
your eyes have never lit upon.
subQuotationList:
['Eh bien, que feras-tu si je te prends avec moi? First of all I must
have fifty thousand francs, and you shall give them to me at Frankfurt.
Then we will go on to Paris, where we will live together, et je te
ferai voir des  toiles en plein jour. Yes, you shall see such women as
your eyes have never lit upon.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Stop a moment. If I were to give you those fifty thousand francs, what
should I have left for myself?
subQuotationList: ['Stop a moment. If I were to give you those fifty thousand francs, what\nshould I have left for myself?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Another hundred thousand francs, please to remember. Besides, I could
live with you in your rooms for a month, or even for two; or even for
longer. But it would not take us more than two months to get through
fifty thousand francs; for, look you, je suis bonne enfante, et tu
verras des  toiles, you may be sure.
subQuotationList:
['Another hundred thousand francs, please to remember. Besides, I could
live with you in your rooms for a month, or even for two; or even for
longer. But it would not take us more than two months to get through
fifty thousand francs; for, look you, je suis bonne enfante, et tu
verras des  toiles, you may be sure.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Mlle. Blanche', 'Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: What? You mean to say that we should spend the whole in two months?
subQuotationList: ['What? You mean to say that we should spend the whole in two months?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Certainly. Does that surprise you very much? Ah, vil esclave! Why, one
month of that life would be better than all your previous existence.
One month et apr s, le d luge! Mais tu ne peux comprendre. Va! Away,
away! You are not worth it. Ah, que fais-tu?
subQuotationList:
['Certainly. Does that surprise you very much? Ah, vil esclave! Why, one
month of that life would be better than all your previous existence.
One month et apr s, le d luge! Mais tu ne peux comprendre. Va! Away,
away! You are not worth it. Ah, que fais-tu?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Eh bien, mon  utchitel , je t attends, si tu
veux. I start in a quarter of an hour s time.
subQuotationList: ['Eh bien, mon  utchitel ,', 'je t attends, si tu\nveux. I start in a quarter of an hour s time.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
No! My account, please, for in ten minutes I shall be
gone.
subQuotationList: ['No!', 'My account, please, for in ten minutes I shall be\ngone.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
To Paris, to Paris! Every man of birth must make
her acquaintance.
subQuotationList: ['To Paris, to Paris!', 'Every man of birth must make\nher acquaintance.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Within a month from now, I shall be back again in Roulettenberg; and _then_
I mean to have it out with you, Mr. Astley!
subQuotationList: ['Within a month from now,', 'I shall be back again in Roulettenberg; and _then_\nI mean to have it out with you, Mr. Astley!']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: What is the matter with you? How dull you are!
subQuotationList: ['What is the matter with you? How dull you are!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Come, come! We are going to spend your two hundred thousand francs for
you, et tu seras heureux comme un petit roi. I myself will tie your tie
for you, and introduce you to Hortense. And when we have spent your
money you shall return here, and break the bank again. What did those
two Jews tell you? that the thing most needed is daring, and that you
possess it? Consequently, this is not the first time that you will be
hurrying to Paris with money in your pocket. Quant   moi, je veux
cinquante mille francs de rente, et alors
subQuotationList:
['Come, come! We are going to spend your two hundred thousand francs for
you, et tu seras heureux comme un petit roi. I myself will tie your tie
for you, and introduce you to Hortense. And when we have spent your
money you shall return here, and break the bank again. What did those
two Jews tell you? that the thing most needed is daring, and that you
possess it? Consequently, this is not the first time that you will be
hurrying to Paris with money in your pocket. Quant   moi, je veux
cinquante mille francs de rente, et alors']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['One Jew'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: But what about the General?
subQuotationList: ['But what about the General?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
The General? You know well enough that at about this hour every day he
goes to buy me a bouquet. On this occasion, I took care to tell him
that he must hunt for the choicest of flowers; and when he returns
home, the poor fellow will find the bird flown. Possibly he may take
wing in pursuit ha, ha, ha! And if so, I shall not be sorry, for he
could be useful to me in Paris, and Mr. Astley will pay his debts
here.
subQuotationList:
['The General? You know well enough that at about this hour every day he
goes to buy me a bouquet. On this occasion, I took care to tell him
that he must hunt for the choicest of flowers; and when he returns
home, the poor fellow will find the bird flown. Possibly he may take
wing in pursuit ha, ha, ha! And if so, I shall not be sorry, for he
could be useful to me in Paris, and Mr. Astley will pay his debts
here.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['The General'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['The General']]]

quoteText:
Et les cent
mille francs qui nous restent, tu les mangeras avec moi,
mon utchitel.
subQuotationList: ['Et les cent\nmille francs qui nous restent,', 'tu les mangeras avec moi,\nmon utchitel.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
so that once and for all I may be on a decent
footing, and proof against any stones which may be thrown at me at all
events for a long time to come.
subQuotationList: ['so that once and for all I may be on a decent\nfooting, and proof against any stones which may be thrown at me at all\nevents for a long time to come.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: What do _you_ want with money?
subQuotationList: ['What do _you_ want with money?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
See what care and taste can do with the most
wretched of means!
subQuotationList: ['See what care and taste can do with the most\nwretched of means!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
C est un utchitel, qui a gagn  deux cent
mille francs, and but for me, would have had not a notion how to spend
them. Presently he will have to return to his tutoring. Does any one
know of a vacant post? You know, one must do something for him.
subQuotationList:
['C est un utchitel,', 'qui a gagn  deux cent
mille francs, and but for me, would have had not a notion how to spend
them. Presently he will have to return to his tutoring. Does any one
know of a vacant post? You know, one must do something for him.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Bibi, surely
you are not angry?
subQuotationList: ['Bibi,', 'surely\nyou are not angry?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: No-o-o: I am merely tired,
subQuotationList: ['No-o-o: I am merely tired,']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You see, I decided to spend so much upon these horses
only because I can easily sell them again. They would go at any time
for _twenty_ thousand francs.
subQuotationList: ['You see,', 'I decided to spend so much upon these horses\nonly because I can easily sell them again. They would go at any time\nfor _twenty_ thousand francs.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Yes, yes. They are splendid horses, and you have got a splendid
turn-out. I am quite content. Let me hear no more of the matter.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, yes. They are splendid horses, and you have got a splendid\nturn-out. I am quite content. Let me hear no more of the matter.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Then you are not angry?
subQuotationList: ['Then you are not angry?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
No. Why should I be? You are wise to provide yourself with what you
need, for it will all come in handy in the future. Yes, I quite see the
necessity of your establishing yourself on a good basis, for without it
you will never earn your million. My hundred thousand francs I look
upon merely as a beginning as a mere drop in the bucket.
subQuotationList:
['No. Why should I be? You are wise to provide yourself with what you
need, for it will all come in handy in the future. Yes, I quite see the
necessity of your establishing yourself on a good basis, for without it
you will never earn your million. My hundred thousand francs I look
upon merely as a beginning as a mere drop in the bucket.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Well, well, what a man you are! Mais tu as l esprit
pour comprendre. Sais-tu, mon gar on, although you are a tutor, you
ought to have been born a prince. Are you not sorry that your money
should be going so quickly?
subQuotationList:
['Well, well, what a man you are!', 'Mais tu as l esprit
pour comprendre. Sais-tu, mon gar on, although you are a tutor, you
ought to have been born a prince. Are you not sorry that your money
should be going so quickly?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText: No. The quicker it goes the better.
subQuotationList: ['No. The quicker it goes the better.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Mais sais-tu mais dis donc, are you _really_ rich? Mais sais-tu, you
have too much contempt for money. Qu est-ce que tu feras apr s, dis
donc?
subQuotationList: ['Mais sais-tu mais dis donc, are you _really_ rich? Mais sais-tu, you\nhave too much contempt for money. Qu est-ce que tu feras apr s, dis\ndonc?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: Apr s I shall go to Homburg, and win another hundred thousand francs.
subQuotationList: ['Apr s I shall go to Homburg, and win another hundred thousand francs.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Oui, oui, c est  a, c est magnifique! Ah, I know you will win them,
and bring them to me when you have done so. Dis donc you will end by
making me love you. Since you are what you are, I mean to love you all
the time, and never to be unfaithful to you. You see, I have not loved
you before parce que je croyais que tu n es qu un utchitel (quelque
chose comme un lacquais, n est-ce pas?) Yet all the time I have been
true to you, parce que je suis bonne fille.
subQuotationList:
['Oui, oui, c est  a, c est magnifique! Ah, I know you will win them,
and bring them to me when you have done so. Dis donc you will end by
making me love you. Since you are what you are, I mean to love you all
the time, and never to be unfaithful to you. You see, I have not loved
you before parce que je croyais que tu n es qu un utchitel (quelque
chose comme un lacquais, n est-ce pas?) Yet all the time I have been
true to you, parce que je suis bonne fille.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
You lie! Did I not see you, the other day, with
Albert with that black-jowled officer?
subQuotationList: ['You lie!', 'Did I not see you, the other day, with\nAlbert with that black-jowled officer?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Oh, oh! Mais tu es
subQuotationList: ['Oh, oh! Mais tu es']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Yes, you are lying right enough. But what makes you suppose that I
should be angry? Rubbish! Il faut que jeunesse se passe. Even if that
officer were here now, I should refrain from putting him out of the
room if I thought you really cared for him. Only, mind you, do not give
him any of my money. You hear?
subQuotationList:
['Yes, you are lying right enough. But what makes you suppose that I
should be angry? Rubbish! Il faut que jeunesse se passe. Even if that
officer were here now, I should refrain from putting him out of the
room if I thought you really cared for him. Only, mind you, do not give
him any of my money. You hear?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You say, do you, that you would not be angry? Mais tu es un vrai
philosophe, sais-tu? Oui, un vrai philosophe! Eh bien, je t aimerai, je
t aimerai. Tu verras-tu seras content.
subQuotationList: ['You say, do you, that you would not be angry? Mais tu es un vrai\nphilosophe, sais-tu? Oui, un vrai philosophe! Eh bien, je t aimerai, je\nt aimerai. Tu verras-tu seras content.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
I have
purposely refrained from making you responsible for my bills or
borrowings, for the reason that I am sorry for you. Any
other woman in my place would have done so, and have let you go to
prison. See, then, how much I love you, and how good-hearted I am!
Think, too, what this accursed marriage with the General is going to
cost me!
subQuotationList:
['I have
purposely refrained from making you responsible for my bills or
borrowings,', 'for the reason that I am sorry for you. Any
other woman in my place would have done so, and have let you go to
prison. See, then, how much I love you, and how good-hearted I am!
Think, too, what this accursed marriage with the General is going to
cost me!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
You are good and clever, and my one regret is that you are also so
wrong-headed. You will _her_ be a rich man!
subQuotationList: ['You are good and clever,', 'and my one regret is that you are also so\nwrong-headed. You will _her_ be a rich man!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: Un vrai Russe un Kalmuk
subQuotationList: ['Un vrai Russe un Kalmuk']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Yes,
yes my children, Yes, you are
right in what you have said about them.
subQuotationList: ['Yes,\nyes my children,', 'Yes, you are\nright in what you have said about them.']
speaker: The General

quoteText:
My unfortunate children! Yes, sir, they _are_
unfortunate children.
subQuotationList: ['My unfortunate children! Yes, sir, they _are_\nunfortunate children.']
speaker: The General

quoteText:
She is an ungrateful woman! She is a bad and ungrateful woman! She has broken up a
family. If there were laws here, I would have her impaled. Yes, I
would.
subQuotationList: ['She is an ungrateful woman!', 'She is a bad and ungrateful woman! She has broken up a\nfamily. If there were laws here, I would have her impaled. Yes, I\nwould.']
speaker: The General

quoteText:
He has ruined me, He has robbed me, and cut
my throat. For two years he was a perfect nightmare to me. For months
at a time he never left me in my dreams. Do not speak of him again.
subQuotationList: ['He has ruined me,', 'He has robbed me, and cut\nmy throat. For two years he was a perfect nightmare to me. For months\nat a time he never left me in my dreams. Do not speak of him again.']
speaker: The General
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Marqis De Griers']], [['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
Il a de la chance, for the Grandmother is now _really_
ill, and therefore, bound to die. Mr. Astley has just sent a telegram
to say so, and you will agree with me that the General is likely to be
her heir. Even if he should not be so, he will not come amiss, since,
in the first place, he has his pension, and, in the second place, he
will be content to live in a back room; whereas _I_ shall be Madame
General, and get into a good circle of society and become a Russian ch telaine. Yes, I shall have a
mansion of my own, and peasants, and a million of money at my back.
subQuotationList:
['Il a de la chance,', 'for the Grandmother is now _really_
ill, and therefore, bound to die. Mr. Astley has just sent a telegram
to say so, and you will agree with me that the General is likely to be
her heir. Even if he should not be so, he will not come amiss, since,
in the first place, he has his pension, and, in the second place, he
will be content to live in a back room; whereas _I_ shall be Madame
General, and get into a good circle of society', 'and become a Russian ch telaine. Yes, I shall have a
mansion of my own, and peasants, and a million of money at my back.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['The General'], ['Mlle. Blanche']], []]

quoteText:
But, suppose he should prove jealous? He might demand all sorts of
things, you know. Do you follow me?
subQuotationList: ['But, suppose he should prove jealous? He might demand all sorts of\nthings, you know. Do you follow me?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Oh, dear no! How ridiculous that would be of him! Besides, I have
taken measures to prevent it. You need not be alarmed. That is to say,
I have induced him to sign notes of hand in Albert s name.
Consequently, at any time I could get him punished. Isn t he
ridiculous?
subQuotationList:
['Oh, dear no! How ridiculous that would be of him! Besides, I have
taken measures to prevent it. You need not be alarmed. That is to say,
I have induced him to sign notes of hand in Albert s name.
Consequently, at any time I could get him punished. Isn t he
ridiculous?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: Very well, then. Marry him.
subQuotationList: ['Very well, then. Marry him.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Il est, pourtant, _tr s_ comme il faut,
subQuotationList: ['Il est, pourtant, _tr s_ comme il faut,']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Mlle. Blanche du Placet! Mlle.
Blanche du Placet, du Placet!
subQuotationList: ['Mlle. Blanche du Placet! Mlle.\nBlanche du Placet, du Placet!']
speaker: The General
referringExpression: he paced the salon in his gala attire and kept repeating to himself
mentionTextsList: [['Mlle. Blanche du Placet', 'Mlle.\nBlanche du Placet, du Placet']]

quoteText:
I must behave altogether differently, Yet, mark you, there is a tiresome circumstance of which
I had never before thought which is, how best to pronounce my new
family name. Zagorianski, Zagozianski, Madame la G n rale de Sago,
Madame la G n rale de Fourteen Consonants oh these infernal Russian
names! The _last_ of them would be the best to use, don t you think?
subQuotationList:
['I must behave altogether differently,', 'Yet, mark you, there is a tiresome circumstance of which
I had never before thought which is, how best to pronounce my new
family name. Zagorianski, Zagozianski, Madame la G n rale de Sago,
Madame la G n rale de Fourteen Consonants oh these infernal Russian
names! The _last_ of them would be the best to use, don t you think?']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
Tu  tais bon
enfant Je te croyais b te et tu en avais l air,
but it suited you.
subQuotationList: ['Tu  tais bon\nenfant', 'Je te croyais b te et tu en avais l air,\nbut it suited you.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText: Attends!
subQuotationList: ['Attends!']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche

quoteText:
They may come in handy for you, for, though you
are a very learned tutor, you are a very stupid man. More than two
thousand francs, however, I am not going to give you, for the reason
that, if I did so, you would gamble them all away. Now good-bye. Nous
serons toujours bons amis, and if you win again, do not fail to come to
me, et tu seras heureux.
subQuotationList:
['They may come in handy for you,', 'for, though you
are a very learned tutor, you are a very stupid man. More than two
thousand francs, however, I am not going to give you, for the reason
that, if I did so, you would gamble them all away. Now good-bye. Nous
serons toujours bons amis, and if you win again, do not fail to come to
me, et tu seras heureux.']
speaker: Mlle. Blanche
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
_You_ here? Well, I had an idea that I should meet you. Do
not trouble to tell me anything, for I know all yes, all. In fact, your
whole life during the past twenty months lies within my knowledge.
subQuotationList: ['_You_ here?', 'Well, I had an idea that I should meet you. Do\nnot trouble to tell me anything, for I know all yes, all. In fact, your\nwhole life during the past twenty months lies within my knowledge.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
How closely you watch the doings of your old friends! That does you infinite credit. But stop a moment. You have reminded me
of something. Was it you who bailed me out of Roulettenberg prison when
I was lying there for a debt of two hundred g lden? _someone_ did so.
subQuotationList: ['How closely you watch the doings of your old friends!', 'That does you infinite credit. But stop a moment. You have reminded me\nof something. Was it you who bailed me out of Roulettenberg prison when\nI was lying there for a debt of two hundred g lden? _someone_ did so.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Oh dear no! though I knew all the time that you were lying there.
subQuotationList: ['Oh dear no! though I knew all the time that you were lying there.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Perhaps you could tell me who _did_ bail me out?
subQuotationList: ['Perhaps you could tell me who _did_ bail me out?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: No; I am afraid I could not.
subQuotationList: ['No; I am afraid I could not.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
What a strange thing! For I know no Russians at all here, so it cannot
have been a Russian who befriended me. In Russia we Orthodox folk _do_
go bail for one another, but in this case I thought it must have been
done by some English stranger who was not conversant with the ways of
the country.
subQuotationList:
['What a strange thing! For I know no Russians at all here, so it cannot
have been a Russian who befriended me. In Russia we Orthodox folk _do_
go bail for one another, but in this case I thought it must have been
done by some English stranger who was not conversant with the ways of
the country.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Well, I am none the less glad to find
that you retain your old independence of spirit, as well as your
buoyancy.
subQuotationList: ['Well,', 'I am none the less glad to find\nthat you retain your old independence of spirit, as well as your\nbuoyancy.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Which means that you are vexed at not having found me more abased and
humiliated than I am?
subQuotationList: ['Which means that you are vexed at not having found me more abased and\nhumiliated than I am?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Your remarks please me as they always did, In those
words I see the clever, triumphant, and, above all things, cynical
friend of former days. Only Russians have the faculty of combining
within themselves so many opposite qualities. Yes, most men love to see
their best friend in abasement; for generally it is on such abasement
that friendship is founded. All thinking persons know that ancient
truth. Yet, on the present occasion, I assure you, I am sincerely glad
to see that you are _not_ cast down. Tell me, are you never going to
give up gambling?
subQuotationList:
['Your remarks please me as they always did,', 'In those
words I see the clever, triumphant, and, above all things, cynical
friend of former days. Only Russians have the faculty of combining
within themselves so many opposite qualities. Yes, most men love to see
their best friend in abasement; for generally it is on such abasement
that friendship is founded. All thinking persons know that ancient
truth. Yet, on the present occasion, I assure you, I am sincerely glad
to see that you are _not_ cast down. Tell me, are you never going to
give up gambling?']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Damn the gambling! Yes, I should certainly have given it up, were it
not that
subQuotationList: ['Damn the gambling! Yes, I should certainly have given it up, were it\nnot that']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
That you are losing? I thought so. You need not tell me any more. I
know how things stand, for you have said that last in despair, and
therefore, truthfully. Have you no other employment than gambling?
subQuotationList: ['That you are losing? I thought so. You need not tell me any more. I\nknow how things stand, for you have said that last in despair, and\ntherefore, truthfully. Have you no other employment than gambling?']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: No; none whatever.
subQuotationList: ['No; none whatever.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You are growing blas , You have not only renounced life,
with its interests and social ties, but the duties of a citizen and a
man; you have not only renounced the friends whom I know you to have
had, and every aim in life but that of winning money; but you have also
renounced your memory. Though I can remember you in the strong, ardent
period of your life, I feel persuaded that you have now forgotten every
better feeling of that period that your present dreams and aspirations
of subsistence do not rise above pair, impair rouge, noir, the twelve
middle numbers, and so forth.
subQuotationList:
['You are growing blas ,', 'You have not only renounced life,
with its interests and social ties, but the duties of a citizen and a
man; you have not only renounced the friends whom I know you to have
had, and every aim in life but that of winning money; but you have also
renounced your memory. Though I can remember you in the strong, ardent
period of your life, I feel persuaded that you have now forgotten every
better feeling of that period that your present dreams and aspirations
of subsistence do not rise above pair, impair rouge, noir, the twelve
middle numbers, and so forth.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Enough, Mr. Astley! Kindly do not recall to me any more recollections, for I can remember
things for myself. Only for a time have I put them out of my head. Only
until I shall have rehabilitated myself, am I keeping my memory dulled.
When that hour shall come, you will see me arise from the dead.
subQuotationList:
['Enough, Mr. Astley!', 'Kindly do not recall to me any more recollections, for I can remember
things for myself. Only for a time have I put them out of my head. Only
until I shall have rehabilitated myself, am I keeping my memory dulled.
When that hour shall come, you will see me arise from the dead.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Then you will have to be here another ten years, Should
I then be alive, I will remind you here, on this very bench of what I
have just said. In fact, I will bet you a wager that I shall do so.
subQuotationList: ['Then you will have to be here another ten years,', 'Should\nI then be alive, I will remind you here, on this very bench of what I\nhave just said. In fact, I will bet you a wager that I shall do so.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Say no more, And to show you that I have
not wholly forgotten the past, may I enquire where Mlle. Polina is? If
it was not you who bailed me out of prison, it must have been she. Yet
never have I heard a word concerning her.
subQuotationList:
['Say no more,', 'And to show you that I have
not wholly forgotten the past, may I enquire where Mlle. Polina is? If
it was not you who bailed me out of prison, it must have been she. Yet
never have I heard a word concerning her.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
No, I do not think it was she. At the present moment she is in
Switzerland, and you will do me a favour by ceasing to ask me these
questions about her.
subQuotationList: ['No, I do not think it was she. At the present moment she is in\nSwitzerland, and you will do me a favour by ceasing to ask me these\nquestions about her.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Which means that she has dealt you a serious wound?
subQuotationList: ['Which means that she has dealt you a serious wound?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Mlle. Polina, Is the best of all possible living
beings; but, I repeat, that I shall thank you to cease questioning me
about her. You never really knew her, and her name on your lips is an
offence to my moral feeling.
subQuotationList:
['Mlle. Polina,', 'Is the best of all possible living
beings; but, I repeat, that I shall thank you to cease questioning me
about her. You never really knew her, and her name on your lips is an
offence to my moral feeling.']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Polina Alexandrovna']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']]]

quoteText:
Indeed? On what subject, then, have I a better right to speak to you
than on this? With it are bound up all your recollections and mine.
However, do not be alarmed: I have no wish to probe too far into your
private, your secret affairs. My interest in Mlle. Polina does not
extend beyond her outward circumstances and surroundings. About them
you could tell me in two words.
subQuotationList:
['Indeed? On what subject, then, have I a better right to speak to you
than on this? With it are bound up all your recollections and mine.
However, do not be alarmed: I have no wish to probe too far into your
private, your secret affairs. My interest in Mlle. Polina does not
extend beyond her outward circumstances and surroundings. About them
you could tell me in two words.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Mr. Astley']]]

quoteText:
Well, on condition that the matter shall end there, I will tell you
that for a long time Mlle. Polina was ill, and still is so. My mother
and sister entertained her for a while at their home in the north of
England, and thereafter Mlle. Polina s grandmother (you remember the
mad old woman?) died, and left Mlle. Polina a personal legacy of seven
thousand pounds sterling. That was about six months ago, and now Mlle.
is travelling with my sister s family my sister having since married.
Mlle. s little brother and sister also benefited by the Grandmother s
will, and are now being educated in London. As for the General, he died
in Paris last month, of a stroke. Mlle. Blanche did well by him, for
she succeeded in having transferred to herself all that he received
from the Grandmother. That, I think, concludes all that I have to
tell.
subQuotationList:
['Well, on condition that the matter shall end there, I will tell you
that for a long time Mlle. Polina was ill, and still is so. My mother
and sister entertained her for a while at their home in the north of

Mlle. s little brother and sister also benefited by the Grandmother s

in Paris last month, of a stroke. Mlle. Blanche did well by him, for
she succeeded in having transferred to herself all that he received
from the Grandmother. That, I think, concludes all that I have to
tell.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

Blanche'], ['The General'], ['Mlle. Blanche'], ['The General'], ['Antonida Vassilievna Tarassevitcha']]]

quoteText: And De Griers? Is he too travelling in Switzerland?
subQuotationList: ['And De Griers? Is he too travelling in Switzerland?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
No; nor do I know where he is. Also I warn you once more that you had
better avoid such hints and ignoble suppositions; otherwise you will
assuredly have to reckon with me.
subQuotationList: ['No; nor do I know where he is. Also I warn you once more that you had\nbetter avoid such hints and ignoble suppositions; otherwise you will\nassuredly have to reckon with me.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: What? In spite of our old friendship?
subQuotationList: ['What? In spite of our old friendship?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Yes, in spite of our old friendship.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, in spite of our old friendship.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Then I beg your pardon a thousand times, Mr. Astley. I meant nothing
offensive to Mlle. Polina, for I have nothing of which to accuse her.
Moreover, the question of there being anything between this Frenchman
and this Russian lady is not one which you and I need discuss, nor even
attempt to understand.
subQuotationList:
['Then I beg your pardon a thousand times, Mr. Astley. I meant nothing
offensive to Mlle. Polina, for I have nothing of which to accuse her.
Moreover, the question of there being anything between this Frenchman
and this Russian lady is not one which you and I need discuss, nor even
attempt to understand.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Mr. Astley'], ['Mr. Astley'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Marqis De Griers'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Mr. Astley']]]

quoteText:
If, you do not care to hear their names coupled
together, may I ask you what you mean by the expressions and  there being anything between
them ? Why do you call them so particularly a  Frenchman  and a
 Russian lady ?
subQuotationList:
['If,', 'you do not care to hear their names coupled
together, may I ask you what you mean by the expressions', 'and  there being anything between
them ? Why do you call them so particularly a  Frenchman  and a
 Russian lady ?']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Polina Alexandrovna', 'Marqis De Griers'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna', 'Marqis De Griers']]]

quoteText:
Ah, I see you are interested, Mr. Astley. But it is a long, long
story, and calls for a lengthy preface. At the same time, the question
is an important one, however ridiculous it may seem at the first
glance. A Frenchman, Mr. Astley, is merely a fine figure of a man. With
this you, as a Britisher, may not agree. With it I also, as a Russian,
may not agree out of envy. Yet possibly our good ladies are of another
opinion. For instance, one may look upon Racine as a broken-down,
hobbledehoy, perfumed individual one may even be unable to read him;
and I too may think him the same, as well as, in some respects, a
subject for ridicule. Yet about him, Mr. Astley, there is a certain
charm, and, above all things, he is a great poet though one might like
to deny it. Yes, the Frenchman, the Parisian, as a national figure, was
in process of developing into a figure of elegance before we Russians
had even ceased to be bears. The Revolution bequeathed to the French
nobility its heritage, and now every whipper-snapper of a Parisian may
possess manners, methods of expression, and even thoughts that are
above reproach in form, while all the time he himself may share in that
form neither in initiative nor in intellect nor in soul his manners,
and the rest, having come to him through inheritance. Yes, taken by
himself, the Frenchman is frequently a fool of fools and a villain of
villains. Per contra, there is no one in the world more worthy of
confidence and respect than this young Russian lady. De Griers might so
mask his face and play a part as easily to overcome her heart, for he
has an imposing figure, Mr. Astley, and this young lady might easily
take that figure for his real self for the natural form of his heart
and soul instead of the mere cloak with which heredity has dowered him.
And even though it may offend you, I feel bound to say that the
majority also of English people are uncouth and unrefined, whereas we
Russian folk can recognise beauty wherever we see it, and are always
eager to cultivate the same. But to distinguish beauty of soul and
personal originality there is needed far more independence and freedom
than is possessed by our women, especially by our younger ladies. At
all events, they need more _experience_. For instance, this Mlle.
Polina pardon me, but the name has passed my lips, and I cannot well
recall it is taking a very long time to make up her mind to prefer you
to Monsieur de Griers. She may respect you, she may become your friend,
she may open out her heart to you; yet over that heart there will be
reigning that loathsome villain, that mean and petty usurer, De Griers.
This will be due to obstinacy and self-love to the fact that De Griers
once appeared to her in the transfigured guise of a marquis, of a
disenchanted and ruined liberal who was doing his best to help her
family and the frivolous old General; and, although these transactions
of his have since been exposed, you will find that the exposure has
made no impression upon her mind. Only give her the De Griers of former
days, and she will ask of you no more. The more she may detest the
present De Griers, the more will she lament the De Griers of the
past even though the latter never existed but in her own imagination.
You are a sugar refiner, Mr. Astley, are you not?
subQuotationList:

quoteText: Yes, I belong to the well-known firm of Lovell and Co.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I belong to the well-known firm of Lovell and Co.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Then see here. On the one hand, you are a sugar refiner, while, on the
other hand, you are an Apollo Belvedere. But the two characters do not
mix with one another. I, again, am not even a sugar refiner; I am a
mere roulette gambler who has also served as a lacquey. Of this fact
Mlle. Polina is probably well aware, since she appears to have an
excellent force of police at her disposal.
subQuotationList:
['Then see here. On the one hand, you are a sugar refiner, while, on the
other hand, you are an Apollo Belvedere. But the two characters do not
mix with one another. I, again, am not even a sugar refiner; I am a
mere roulette gambler who has also served as a lacquey. Of this fact
Mlle. Polina is probably well aware, since she appears to have an
excellent force of police at her disposal.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
You are saying this because you are feeling bitter, Yet there is not the least originality in your
words.
subQuotationList: ['You are saying this because you are feeling bitter,', 'Yet there is not the least originality in your\nwords.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
I agree. But therein lies the horror of it all that, how trepidation,
playing ever mean and farcical my accusations may be, they are none the
less _true_. But I am only wasting words.
subQuotationList: ['I agree. But therein lies the horror of it all that, how trepidation,\nplaying ever mean and farcical my accusations may be, they are none the\nless _true_. But I am only wasting words.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: Yes, you are, for you are only talking nonsense!
subQuotationList: ['Yes, you are, for you are only talking nonsense!']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText:
Are you
aware, that wretched, ignoble, petty, unfortunate man
though you are, it was at _her_ request I came to Homburg, in order to
see you, and to have a long, serious talk with you, and to report to
her your feelings and thoughts and hopes yes, and your recollections of
her, too?
subQuotationList:
['Are you
aware,', 'that wretched, ignoble, petty, unfortunate man
though you are, it was at _her_ request I came to Homburg, in order to
see you, and to have a long, serious talk with you, and to report to
her your feelings and thoughts and hopes yes, and your recollections of
her, too?']
speaker: Mr. Astley
mentionEntitiesList: [[['Alexis Ivanovitch']], [['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Alexis Ivanovitch'], ['Polina Alexandrovna']]]

quoteText: Indeed? Is that really so?
subQuotationList: ['Indeed? Is that really so?']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
Yes, poor unfortunate, She _did_ love you; and I
may tell you this now for the reason that now you are utterly lost.
Even if I were also to tell you that she still loves you, you would
none the less have to remain where you are. Yes, you have ruined
yourself beyond redemption. Once upon a time you had a certain amount
of talent, and you were of a lively disposition, and your good looks
were not to be despised. You might even have been useful to your
country, which needs men like you. Yet you remained here, and your life
is now over. I am not blaming you for this in my view all Russians
resemble you, or are inclined to do so. If it is not roulette, then it
is something else. The exceptions are very rare. Nor are you the first
to learn what a taskmaster is yours. For roulette is not exclusively a
Russian game. Hitherto, you have honourably preferred to serve as a
lacquey rather than to act as a thief; but what the future may have in
store for you I tremble to think. Now good-bye. You are in want of
money, I suppose? Then take these ten louis d or. More I shall not give
you, for you would only gamble it away. Take care of these coins, and
farewell. Once more, _take care_ of them.
subQuotationList:
['Yes, poor unfortunate,', 'She _did_ love you; and I

quoteText: No, Mr. Astley. After all that has been said I
subQuotationList: ['No, Mr. Astley. After all that has been said I']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText:
_Take care_ of them! I am certain you are still
a gentleman, and therefore I give you the money as one gentleman may
give money to another. Also, if I could be certain that you would leave
both Homburg and the gaming-tables, and return to your own country, I
would give you a thousand pounds down to start life afresh; but, I give
you ten louis d or instead of a thousand pounds for the reason that at
the present time a thousand pounds and ten louis d or will be all the
same to you you will lose the one as readily as you will the other.
Take the money, therefore, and good-bye.
subQuotationList:

same to you you will lose the one as readily as you will the other.
Take the money, therefore, and good-bye.']
speaker: Mr. Astley

quoteText: Yes, I _will_ take it if at the same time you will embrace me.
subQuotationList: ['Yes, I _will_ take it if at the same time you will embrace me.']
speaker: Alexis Ivanovitch

quoteText: With pleasure.
subQuotationList: ['With pleasure.']

Perhaps I shall need it for
a meal,
